{{Infobox mountain|name=Eastridge|photo=|map=England|map_alt=Eastridge, Shropshire|map_caption=Location in England|location=[[Shropshire]], England|label_position=right|coordinates={{coord|52|37|24|N|2|54|20|W|type:mountain_scale:100000|display=inline,title|format=dms}}}} '''Eastridge Mountain Bike Trail Centre''' is a free [[mountain biking]] venue in Shropshire, UK.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mbr.co.uk/routes/eastridge-stiperstones-route-356706|title=Eastridge and Stiperstones, Shropshire route - MBR|date=2017-03-08|work=MBR|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://getoutside.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/local/eastridge-wood-shropshire|title=Eastridge Wood, Shropshire - area information, map, walks and more|work=OS GetOutside|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref> The venue is developed and maintained by volunteers,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.moredirt.com/trail/United-Kingdom_West-Midlands/Eastridge-Woods-Trail-Centre/1483|title=Eastridge Woods Trail Centre|website=MoreDirt|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref> and features a mixture of blue, red and black graded trails.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.forestry.gov.uk/pdf/eastridgeWoodsPanel_2011_final.pdf/$file/eastridgeWoodsPanel_2011_final.pdf|title=Forestry commission Eastridge Woods|last=|first=|date=|website=forestry.gov.uk|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> There are also a number of steep, technical off-piste trails.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.redbull.com/gb-en/5-uncrowded-trail-centres-uk|title=5 uncrowded trail centres UK|last=|first=|date=|website=redbull.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref> Since 1991 Eastridge Woods have been used to host [[Downhill mountain biking|Downhill]] and [[Cross-country cycling|XC]] mountain biking events since the 90's hosted the [[British National Mountain Biking Championships|British National Mountain biking Championships]] in 1993,1994,1995,1996 and 1999.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.britishcycling.org.uk/mtb/article/mtb20090713-Retrospective--British-Mountain-Bike-Championships-0|title=Retrospective: British Mountain Bike Championships|work=British Cycling|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pinkbike.com/news/British-National-DH-XC-Championships.html|title=The Descent-Gear/MSC Bikes National DH Championships 2009 - Preview. - Pinkbike|work=Pinkbike|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ukmtbhalloffame.com/hall-of-fame-2012/helen-mortimer/|title=Helen Mortimer {{!}} UK Mountain Bike Hall of Fame|website=ukmtbhalloffame.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mikrotime.com/mtb/bcf/bcfch99p4.html|title=BCF National Downhill Championships 1999 - Eastridge|website=mikrotime.com|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref>
== Geology == [[File:Shropshire geology.gif|left|thumb|A geological map of the area.]] Eastridge Wood is located in the [[Shropshire Hills AONB|Shropshire Hills]], between the Villages of Habberley, Minsterley and Snailbeach, it lies east of the quartzite ridge known as the [[Stiperstones]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=TylerB.Sc.|first=W.H.|date=1925|title=Notes on sheet 48 N.W. (Shropshire)|url=|journal=https://doi.org/10.1016/S0016-7878(25)80027-0|volume=|pages=377–378|via=}}</ref> The Rocky outcrop that forms Eastridge is known as the Habberly Formation and is thought to correlate with the [[Hunnebergia]]n Stage of Scandinavia. It is the youngest known [[tremadocian|tremadoc]] in the [[Welsh Borderland Fault System|Welsh Borderlands]] geological area.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Fortey, Owens|first=R.A, R.M|date=1992|title=The Habberley Formation: youngest Tremadoc in the Welsh Borderlands|url=|journal=Geological Magazine|volume=129 |issue=5|pages=553–566|via=}}</ref>
== Trail partnership == [[File:Goliath Climb Eastridge, Revelation Trail.jpg|thumb|A view of the Shropshire hills from the Goliath Climb.]] The trails are located on [[Forestry Commission]] land and are signposted from the [[A5 road (Great Britain)|A5]] near, Shrewsbury. The trails are built, run and maintained by a group of volunteers working in partnership with the Forestry commission in England.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://bikemagic.com/news/new-trail-planned-for-eastridge-woods.html|title=New trail planned for Eastridge Woods - Bike Magic|work=Bike Magic|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-US}}</ref>
== History == [[File:Snailbeach Mine Railway Network.jpg|left|thumb|Relics of the old railway network that ran through Eastridge]]
=== Pre Mountain bike years === [[File:Eastridge Looking at Snailbeach.jpg|thumb|View of Snailbeach from the bottom of the Topography Trail.]] The area was mined for lead and other minerals until 1955. At one point it was believed to be the most productive lead mine in Europe, it even had its own railway network: [[Snailbeach District Railways]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.shropshiresgreatoutdoors.co.uk/site/snailbeach-mine/|title=Snailbeach Mine {{!}} Shropshire's Great Outdoors|website=shropshiresgreatoutdoors.co.uk|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref> Relics from the mine workings can still be found today at the nearby village of [[Snailbeach]].<ref>{{Cite book|title=Geotourism : Sustainability, Impacts and Management|last=Newsome|first=David|publisher=Routledge|year=2005|isbn=|location=|pages=}}</ref>
=== Early History === The first races at the venue were organised by local cycling club, the Mid Shropshire Wheelers in collaboration with the [[British Cycling Federation|British cycling federation]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mikrotime.com/mtb/bcf/east99sl.html|title=RAV4 BCF National Downhill Champs - Eastridge|website=mikrotime.com|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref> In 1998 the venue hosted a round of the National Mountain Bike Points Series and featured in the satellite TV program ''Mountain Bike Britain''.<ref>{{Citation|last=chronic racing|title=Mountain Bike Britain 98 Eastridge Rd 4|date=2011-04-02|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t1j6NLkxamc|accessdate=2018-06-03}}</ref>
=== Gravity Enduro resurgence === Eastrige fell out of favor as a downhill venue due to longer and steeper courses being built in other parts of the UK. However it experienced something of a resurgence in popularity due to the emergence of the gravity enduro mountain bike discipline. Recent years have seen the venue continuing to host [[British Cycling Federation]] sanctioned [[Cross-country mountain biker|cross country mountain bike]] races at regional level,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xcracer.com/raceentry/index.php?series_id=177|title=Midlands MTB Series 2018|website=XC Racer.com|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref name="Events">{{Cite news|url=https://www.britishcycling.org.uk/events/details/128606/2015-Midlands-Mtb-Series---Round-6---Eastridge---Presented-by-Torq-Performance|title=Events|work=British Cycling|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.britishcycling.org.uk/events/details/142537/2016-Midlands-Mtb-Series---Round-5---Eastridge---Presented-by-Torq-Performance|title=Events|work=British Cycling|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref> as well as national level gravity enduro races.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xcracer.com/uk-gravity-enduro-eastridge.html|title=UK Gravity Enduro, Eastridge|website=XC Racer.com|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.expix.co.uk/index.php/events-list/event/232-uk-gravity-enduro-series-2018-stop-2-eastridge-woods|title=UK Gravity Enduro Series 2018 Stop 2 Eastridge Woods|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref>
== Marked Trails ==
=== The Easty Blue === A moderately difficult trail of 2.8 km in length, the Easty blue is aimed at beginners.<ref name=":0" />
=== Revelation Trail === [[File:1F5C438E-3B86-4DD8-97DF-17B35B14086.jpg|thumb|Road Crossing on ''Student Championships'' Downhill Course.]] This 8 kilometer loop is graded '''Red''' for difficult and covers many of the venue's most popular descents including; Son and Daughter, Big Log and Topography. The latter of which passes the mine workings in the village of [[Snailbeach]]. The trail is approximately 8 kilometers in length and was built in partnership with [https://www.pinkbike.com/directory/9195/eastridge-trail-partnership/ The Eastridge Trail Partnership], Revelation is composed of tight twisty single track, off camber traverses, roots, rocks, ruts, climbs and hairpin bends. The natural, rough nature of the trail regularly divides opinion;<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.moredirt.com/trail/United-Kingdom_West-Midlands/Revelation-Trail/197|title=Revelation Trail|website=MoreDirt|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref> with some favoring its rough natural terrain and others deriding it for its lack of bike park style features.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.forestry.gov.uk/forestry/englandherefordshirethemarcheseastridgeeastridgecarparkrevelationtrail|title=Revelation Trail|last=England|first=Forestry Commission,|website=forestry.gov.uk|language=en-gb|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite journal|last=Darkins|first=Max|date=Autumn 2016|title=The Big Ride UK|url=https://www.pressreader.com/australia/mountain-biking-uk/20161110/282578787602919|journal=Mountain Biking UK|volume=|pages=|via=Pressreader}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.trailforks.com/route/revelation-trail/|title=Revelation Trail {{!}} Trailforks|website=Trailforks|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fortodayweride.blogspot.com/2012/03/dry-loose-and-steep-eastridge.html|title=ForTodayWeRide: Dry, loose, and steep - Eastridge Revelation Trail|last=Swisschris|website=ForTodayWeRide|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref>
=== 2006 student champs downhill course === In 2006 the BUSA National Student Downhill Mountain biking championships were held at Eastridge after the venue was changed from Moelfre days before the event was due to take place.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://ride.io/racing/busa-student-champs-2006/|title=BUSA Student Champs 2006 - Ride It Out|date=2006-03-30|work=Ride It Out|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-US}}</ref> The course is graded '''black''' for experienced riders only and consists of a relatively flat but rocky top section with two jumps and a much steeper and very rocky bottom section.<ref name=":1" /> Beginning in 2009 the course has been included as a stage in several gravity enduro races including the UK gravity enduro series and is known for being fast, rocky and technical.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://enduro-mtb.com/en/race-report-welsh-gravity-enduro-autumn-series-eastridge-clock-watching/|title=Race Report: Welsh Gravity Enduro Autumn Series, Eastridge. Clock Watching {{!}} ENDURO Mountainbike Magazine|date=2016-09-08|work=ENDURO Mountainbike Magazine|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-US}}</ref>
=== 99 Nationals course === At just 0.5 km the 99 Nationals course is relatively short.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.forestry.gov.uk/pdf/eastridgeWoodsPanel_2011_final.pdf/$file/eastridgeWoodsPanel_2011_final.pdf|title=|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> The 99 Nationals course was used for the 1999 National Mountain Bike championships. Since then it has been used in regional level downhill races and national level gravity enduro races.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://bikemagic.com/news/eastridge-uk-gravity-enduro-2013-report.html|title=Eastridge UK Gravity Enduro 2013 Report - Bike Magic|work=Bike Magic|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-US}}</ref>
== Unmarked trails == Eastridge is home to a large network of unmarked trails, many of which are used for races.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://archive.org/details/Mountain_Biking_Skills_2016_UK|title=Mountain Biking Skills 2016 UK}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://updoc.tips/download/free-pdf-ebook-mountain-biking-september-2015-uk|title=[PDF] Mountain Biking - September 2015 UK - Free Download PDF|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en}}</ref>
== Facilities == As Eastridge Trail Centre is free and run by volunteers facilities are limited to a small carpark.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/travel/2016/may/14/mountain-bike-day-tour-shropshire-hills|title=Over the Shropshire hills and far away – by mountain bike|last=Haddad|first=Sam|date=2016-05-14|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref>
== Past events held in Eastridge Woods ==
* UK Gravity Enduro Series, 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mbuk.com/articles/unmissable-mountain-bike-events-of-2018/|title=Unmissable mountain bike events of 2018|work=Mountain Biking UK|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ukgravityenduro.com/2-may-26th-27th-eastridge-uk/|title=#2 May 26th & 27th Eastridge, UK – UK Gravity Enduro 2018|website=ukgravityenduro.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref> * Welsh Gravity Enduro 2017, round 4.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://welshgravityenduro.com/eastridge-round-4-info/|title=Eastridge Round 1 Info|work=Welsh Gravity Enduro|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref> * [[Cannondale Bicycle Corporation|Cannondale]] British Enduro Series, 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://enduro-mtb.com/en/race-report-cannonade-british-enduro-series-eastridge-shropshire/|title=Race Report: Cannondale British Enduro Series, Eastridge Shropshire {{!}} ENDURO Mountainbike Magazine|date=2016-08-16|work=ENDURO Mountainbike Magazine|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pinkbike.com/news/cannondale-british-enduro-series-round-4-eastridge-day-two-2016.html|title=Cannondale British Enduro Series 2016, Round 4 - Eastridge, Day Two - Pinkbike|work=Pinkbike|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en}}</ref> * Midlands XC round 6, 2015.<ref name="Events"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rootsandrain.com/race3338/2015-jul-12-midlands-xc-6-eastridge/results/|title=2015 Midlands XC round 6 at Eastridge|website=Roots & Rain|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://vimeo.com/133431686|title=Midlands XC Series 2015, Round 6 Eastridge Woods|website=Vimeo|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.torqfitness.co.uk/news/midlands-xc-eastridge|title=Midlands XC Eastridge - TORQ Ltd|date=2015-07-29|work=TORQ Ltd|access-date=2018-06-03|language=en-GB}}</ref> * Midlands XC round 4, 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rootsandrain.com/race3442/2014-may-18-midlands-xc-4-eastridge/results/|title=2014 Midlands XC round 4 at Eastridge|website=Roots & Rain|language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref>
== References == <!-- Inline citations added to your article will automatically display here. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WP:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> {{reflist}}

[[Image:Ewa Mataya Laurence.JPG|thumb|right|Ewa Laurance]] '''Ewa Laurance''' (born '''Ewa Svensson''', February 26, 1964, [[Gävle]], [[Sweden]], and formerly known as '''Ewa Mataya''' and transitionally as '''Ewa Mataya Laurance''') is a Swedish–American professional [[Pool (cue sports)|pool (pocket billiards)]] player, most notably on the [[Women's Professional Billiard Association]] [[nine-ball]] tour, a [[sports writer]], and more recently a [[sports commentator]] for [[ESPN]]. In 2004, she was inducted into the [[Billiard Congress of America]]'s [[BCA Hall of Fame|Hall of Fame]].[http://www.bca-pool.com/cgi/site/framegate.cgi?url=http://www.bca-pool.com/industry/hof/hof.shtml&cat=i Induction into BCA Hall of Fame 2004] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070331000000/http://www.bca-pool.com/cgi/site/framegate.cgi?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bca-pool.com%2Findustry%2Fhof%2Fhof.shtml&cat=i |date=March 31, 2007 }} She has been nicknamed "the Leading Lady of Billiards" and "the Striking Viking". ==Playing career== Laurance has been playing pool since she was 14 years old. She moved to the [[United States of America|United States]] in 1981{{Dubious|date=April 2008}} after competing at the [[New York City]] World Championships. Laurance has won numerous major women's pool titles, including the [[WPA World Nine-ball Championship]], [[US Open Nine-ball Championship]], [[Women's Professional Billiard Association|WPBA]] National Nine-ball Championship, [[International Trickshot Championship]] and the Swedish and European [[Straight pool|14.1]] Championships. In 2005, Laurance bested three of her peers, WPBA tour members [[Allison Fisher]], [[Dawn Hopkins]], and [[Gerda Hofstatter]], at the Women's Trick Shot Challenge held at the New York Hotel Casino in [[Las Vegas Strip|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], pocketing [[United States dollar|US$]]25,000 as the grand prize. Animated and expressive, she played to the audience and the cameras, "a true showperson in her element and a wonderful example to all trick shot artists." "Laurance Lassos a Win," by Sally Timko, pages 28-29, ''InsidePOOL Magazine'', December 2005 ==Television== She was the co-host of the [[Game Show Network|GSN]] original game show ''[[Ballbreakers]]''. She has hosted the ''[[Ultimate Pool Party]]'' on [[ESPN]]. She has also been a model, appearing in [[Television commercial|TV commercials]] for No Nonsense brand pantyhose, and appeared on ''[[National Bingo Night (US game show)|National Bingo Night]]'' on June 1, 2007. She frequently acts as a color commentator on ESPN telecasts of nine-ball tournaments, usually along with her husband [[Mitch Laurance]]. She has recently been featured on commercials featuring Dick's Pawn Shop in Myrtle Beach, SC. ==Writing== She has authored three books, ''The Ewa Mataya Pool Guide'', ''The Complete Idiot's Guide to Pool & Billiards'', and ''Quick Start Guide to Pocket Billiards''{{Clarify|date=March 2008}}. She has also written monthly columns for ''Pool & Billiard'' magazine. ==Personal life== In 1982, at the age of 17, she married the colorful pool pro [[Jimmy Mataya]], fourteen years her senior, forming pool's first power couple. They later divorced, with Ewa retaining the surname Mataya, as she was already professionally well known by this name. They have a daughter, Nikki, born in 1985.{{cite news| title= Everybody Loves Ewa| first= Mike| last= Geffner| page= 52| url= http://www.billiardsdigest.com/current_issue/apr_04/story_5.php| work= [[Billiards Digest]]| date= April 2004}} In 1994, she married actor [[Mitchell Laurance|Mitch Laurance]], later also pool commentator for [[ESPN]] and twin brother of actor [[Matthew Laurance]]. She continues to introduce herself with the name Ewa Mataya Laurance and also signs autographs retaining the surname Mataya.February 2014, London, Ontario, Canada ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20000302161855/http://www.strikingviking.com/ Her official web site] * [https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1233174/ "Ewa Mataya Laurance" profile], at the ''[[Internet Movie Database]]'' * [https://web.archive.org/web/20061121181638/http://www.poolmag.com/tips.cfm Ewa Laurance instruction column at poolmag.com]
{{s-start}} {{succession box | before=[[Loree Jon Jones]]| title=[[List of WPA World Nine-ball Champions|WPA Women's World Nine-ball Champion]] | after=[[Gerda Hofstatter]]| years=1994}} {{s-end}} {{World 9-ball champions}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Laurance, Ewa Mataya}} [[Category:Swedish pool players]] [[Category:American pool players]] [[Category:Swedish emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Trick shot artists]] [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Female pool players]] [[Category:People from Gävle]] [[Category:World champions in pool]] [[Category:American sportswomen]]

revision.comment: Move 2nd ISBN outside cite template. Minor format edits.
revision.text:
{{redirect|Wolf child|a video game|Wolfchild|a Silver Convention album containing the song of the same name|Summernights|the East Prussian orphans|Wolf children}} {{Other uses|Wild child (disambiguation){{!}}Wild child}} {{pp-move-indef}}
[[File:Mowgli-1895-illustration.png|thumb|[[Mowgli]] was a fictional feral child in [[Rudyard Kipling]]'s ''[[The Jungle Book]]''.]] A '''feral child''' (also called '''wild child''') is a [[human]] child who has lived isolated from human contact from a very young age, where they have little or no experience of human care, behavior or human [[language]]. There are several confirmed cases and other speculative ones. Feral children may have experienced severe [[Child abuse|abuse]] or [[Psychological trauma|trauma]] before being abandoned or running away. They are sometimes the subjects of [[folklore]] and [[legend]]s, typically portrayed as having been raised by animals.
==Description== Feral children lack the basic [[social skills]] that are normally learned in the process of [[enculturation]]. For example, they may be unable to learn to use a [[toilet]], have trouble learning to walk upright after walking on fours all their lives, or display a complete lack of interest in the human activity around them. They often seem mentally impaired and have almost insurmountable trouble [[language acquisition|learning a human language]].<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.zmescience.com/other/feature-post/feral-children/|title = Mind Blowing Cases of Children Raised by Animals|date = December 1, 2014|accessdate = February 20, 2015|website = ZME Science|publisher = |last = Mihai|first = Andrei}}</ref> The impaired ability to learn a [[natural language]] after having been isolated for so many years is often attributed to the existence of a [[critical period]] for language learning, and taken as evidence in favor of the [[critical period hypothesis]].<ref name="Birdsong1999">{{cite book|author=David Birdsong|title=Second Language Acquisition and the Critical Period Hypothesis|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=d7OPAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA74&lpg=PA74&focus=viewport&q=curtiss%201977|year=1999|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-1-135-67489-2|page=74}}</ref><!-- url=http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.475.3365&rep=rep1&type=pdf This is an illegal scan, not sure whether the link should be included here--><ref name="Curtiss2014">{{cite book|author=Susan Curtiss|title=Genie: A Psycholinguistic Study of a Modern-Day Wild Child|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pSy0BQAAQBAJ&pg=PA207&lpg=PA207&focus=viewport&q=%22critical%20period%22|date=10 May 2014|publisher=Elsevier Science|isbn=978-1-4832-1761-1|page=207}}</ref>
There is little scientific knowledge about feral children. One of the best-documented cases has supposedly been that of sisters [[Amala and Kamala]], described by Reverend J. A. L. Singh in 1926 as having been "raised by wolves" in a forest in India. French surgeon [[Serge Aroles]], however, has persuasively argued that the case was a fraud, perpetrated by Singh in order to raise money for his orphanage. Child psychologist [[Bruno Bettelheim]] states that Amala and Kamala were born mentally and physically disabled.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Bettelheim|first1=Bruno|title=Feral Children and Autistic Children|journal=American Journal of Sociology|date=March 1959|volume=64|issue=5|pages=455–467|doi=10.1086/222541|url=https://autisticacademic.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/bettelheim-feral-children-and-autistic-children.pdf|jstor=2773433}}</ref> Yet other scientific studies of feral children exist, such as the case of [[Genie (feral child)|Genie]].<ref name="Curtiss2014"/>
== History ==
Around the 20th century, psychologists were attempting to differentiate between behavior and biological culture. Feral children who lived in isolation or with animals provided examples of this dilemma.
Prior to the 1600s, feral and wild children stories were usually limited to myths and legends. In those tales, the depiction of feral children included hunting for food, running on all fours, and not knowing language. Philosophers and scientists were infatuated with such children, and began to question if these children were part of a different species from the human family.
The question was taken seriously as science tried to name and categorize the development of humans, and the understanding of the natural world in the 18th and 19th century.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.britannica.com/topic/feral-children|title=Feral children|work=Encyclopedia Britannica|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en}}</ref>
==Documented cases of feral children== ===Raised by primates=== [[Marina Chapman]] lived with [[weeper capuchin]] monkeys in the [[Colombia]]n jungle from the age of four to about nine, following a botched kidnapping in about 1954.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hattenstone|first1=Simon|title=Was Marina Chapman really brought up by monkeys?|url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2013/apr/13/marina-chapman-monkeys|accessdate=4 November 2017|work=The Guardian|date=13 April 2013}}</ref> Unusual for feral children, she went on to marry, have children and live a largely normal life with no persisting problems.
Robert (1982) lost his parents in the [[Ugandan Bush War|Ugandan Civil War]] at the age of three, when [[Milton Obote]]'s looting and murdering soldiers raided their village, around {{convert|50|mi|km|-1}} from [[Kampala]]. Robert then survived in the wild, presumably with [[vervet monkey]]s, for three years until he was found by soldiers.<ref>{{cite news|title=Raised by monkeys, strugging to be human|url=https://www.newvision.co.ug/new_vision/news/1314386/raised-monkeys-strugging-human|accessdate=4 November 2017|work=New Vision|date=17 February 2013}}</ref>
Saturday Mthiyane (or Mifune) (1987), a boy of around five, was found after spending about a year in the company of monkeys in [[KwaZulu-Natal]], South Africa. He was given the name Saturday after the day he was found, and Mthiyane was the name of the headmistress of the Special School which took him in. In 2005, at the age of around 17, he could still not talk, and still walked and jumped like a monkey. He never ate cooked food and refused to share or play with other children.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mg.co.za/article/1997-11-21-child-of-the-wild-still-spurns-life-as-a-human|title=Child of the wild still spurns life as a human|date=21 November 1997|work=Mail and Guardian|accessdate=4 November 2017}}</ref>
John Ssebunya, from [[Uganda]], was a toddler when his mother died. Instead of going into a care facility, he went to live with vervet monkeys. For two years he learned how to forage and travel. The monkeys protected him in the wild. When he was around seven years old, he was brought back to civilization. The only form of communication he could do was cry, and he was described as always wanting food. Some considered him “wild” and “scary.” <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/news/raised-in-the-wild-tales-of-survival-8165967.html|title=Raised in the wild: tales of survival|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-GB}}</ref>
===Raised by wolves=== [[Hesse|Hessian]] wolf-children<ref name="Rauber">{{Cite book | first = August Antinous | last = Rauber | title = Homo sapiens ferus: oder, die Bustände der verwilderten und ihre bedeutung für wissenschaft, politik und schule | publisher = Julius Bregse | year = 1888| location = Leipzig | pages = | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=kpYWAAAAIAAJ}}</ref>{{rp|15–7}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" /><ref>Fantini, Alvino. ''Language Acquisition of a Bilingual Child: A Sociolinguistic Perspective (To Age Ten)''. United Kingdom: Multilingual Matters, 1985.</ref> (1304, 1341 and 1344).
[[Marcos Rodríguez Pantoja]] (ca. 1946, [[Sierra Morena]], Spain) lived for 12 years with wolves in the mountains of Southern Spain. He was discovered at age 19.<ref>[http://www.veterinari.vda.it/index.php?option=com_attachments&task=download&id=128 Lupine Lore by Walter Tarello]</ref> Rodríguez's story was depicted in the 2010 Spanish-German film ''Entrelobos''. For his portrayal of Rodríguez, young actor Manuel Camacho received a ''Best New Actor'' nomination at the ''[[25th Goya Awards|2011 Goya Awards]]''.
===Raised by dogs=== [[Oxana Malaya]] was an eight-year-old girl who lived with dogs for six years. She was found in a kennel with dogs in 1991. She was neglected by her parents who were alcoholics. The three-year-old looking for comfort crawled into the farm and snuggled in with the dogs. Her behavior imitated dogs more than humans. She walked on all fours, bared her teeth, and barked. She was removed from her parents' custody by the social services.{{Citation needed|date=September 2018}} As she lacked human contact she did not know any words besides "yes" and "no".<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/culture/story/20151012-feral-the-children-raised-by-wolves|title=Feral: The children raised by wolves|last=Macdonald|first=Fiona|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref> Upon adulthood, Oxana has been taught to subdue her dog-like behavior. She learned to speak fluently and intelligently<ref name="oxana">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CSifkl8WQQw|title=Oxana Malaya on Ukrainian TV show|author=Channel Ukraine}}</ref> and works at the farm milking cows,<ref name="oxana_m">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/3653890/Cry-of-an-enfant-sauvage.html|title=Cry of an infant savage|last=Grice|first=Elizabeth|date=2006-07-17|accessdate=2007-07-14|publisher=Daily Telegraph|location=London}}</ref><ref name="oxana" /> but remains somewhat intellectually impaired.<ref>[http://fakty.ua/71455-u-geroini-publikacii-quot-faktov-quot-oksany-maloj-kotoraya-vyrosla-v-sobachej-konure-nashlis-rodnoj-brat-i-malenkaya-plemyannica-tozhe-oksana У героини публикации «фактов» оксаны малой, которая выросла в… Собачьей конуре, нашлись родной брат и маленькая племянница, тоже оксана] – 2003 follow-up article in ''[[Fakty i kommentarii]]'' {{uk icon}}.</ref> Years later, Oxana admitted on a Russian talkshow that her story was slightly less dramatic; neglected by her parents, she sought out the company of the dogs and learned to imitate them as they were more responsive than her parents.
[[Ivan Mishukov]], a six-year-old boy was rescued by the police in 1998 from wild dogs, who he lived with for two years. He ran from his mother and her abusive alcoholic boyfriend at the age of four. He earned the dogs' trust by giving them food and in return the dogs protected him.<ref name="The Independent">{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/siberian-boy-7-raised-by-dogs-after-parents-abandoned-him-555343.html|title=Siberian boy, 7, raised by dogs after parents abandoned him|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-GB}}</ref> The boy had risen to being "[[Alpha (biology)|alpha male]]" of the pack.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/siberian-boy-7-raised-by-dogs-after-parents-abandoned-him-6164250.html|title=Siberian boy, 7, raised by dogs after parents abandoned him|author=Osborn, Andrew|date=August 4, 2004|newspaper=The Independent|accessdate=2013-05-20}}</ref> When the police found him, they set a trap for him and the dogs by leaving food in a restaurant kitchen.<ref name="The Independent"/> Because he had lived among the dogs for only two years, he relearned language fairly rapidly.<ref name="ivan">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CSifkl8WQQw|title=Raised by Dogs. Ukrainian TV show|author=Channel Ukraine}}</ref> He studied in military school and served in the Russian Army.<ref name="ivan" />
A 10-year-old Chilean boy (Dog Boy) was abandoned by his parents, lived with street dogs who hunted for food with him, and may have nursed him. At the age of five, the boy was abandoned by his parents and escaped a child care facility with 15 street dogs. The boy lived in a cave with the stray dogs and searched for food with them. He would search garbage cans to find leftover food to eat. He was raised by dogs since he was little. In 2001, he was found by the police, and he tried to escape by going into the water. However, he was caught and hospitalized.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/International/story?id=80914&page=1|title='Dog Boy' of Chile Rescued|last=News|first=A. B. C.|date=2006-01-06|website=ABC News|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>
Traian Căldărar, Romania (found in 2002) also known as "the Romanian Dog Boy" or "Mowgli". From the ages of four to seven, Trajan lived without his family. The boy was found at the age of seven and was described as a three-year-old due to undernutrition. His mother had left her home because of domestic violence, and Traian ran from home sometime after his mother left. He lived in the wild and took shelter in a cardboard box. He suffered from infected wounds, having poor circulation, and a children's disease caused by vitamin D deficiency. Traian was found by Manolescu Ioan, who had been walking across the country after his car broke down. In the surrounding area, a dog that had been eaten was also found. Many assume that the boy was eating the dog to stay alive. When Traian was being cared for, he would usually sleep under the bed and wanted to eat all the time. In 2007, Traian was being taken care of by his grandfather and was doing well in 3rd grade at school.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://sociologychis.wordpress.com/2016/05/12/modern-day-feral-children/|title=Modern day Feral children|date=2016-05-12|work=Sociologychis|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-US}}</ref> Now, he is a normal child who likes football and mathematics.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/romania/1390871/Wolf-boy-is-welcomed-home-by-mother-after-years-in-the-wild.html |title=Wolf boy is welcomed home by mother after years in the wild |accessdate=2014-07-02 |date=2002-04-14 |journal=Daily Telegraph | location=London}}</ref>
Andrei Tolstyk (2004) was raised by dogs in a remote part of Siberia from the age of three months to 7 years. He was neglected by his parents because he had speaking and hearing problems. Social workers who found the boy were curious about why the boy was not admitted to his local school. This boy was not able to talk as he lacked human interaction and had many dog-like characteristics including walking on all fours, biting people, and sniffing his food before eating.<ref name="The Independent"/>
Madina, a three-year-old girl. Madina lived with dogs from birth until she was three years old. She slept with them in the cold, ate food with them, and played with them. Her father left her after she was born, and her mother became an alcoholic. She never looked after Madina since she was always too drunk and Madina would chew on bones from the floor with the dogs. When social workers found Madina in 2013, she acted like dogs and was not wearing any clothes. Madina was being taken care of and the doctors said that she was mentally and physically healthy even after what she had gone through.<ref name=":0" />
===Raised by bears=== The three Lithuanian bear-boys (1657, 1669, 1694)<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|21–28}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" /> – [[Serge Aroles]] shows from the archives of the [[Queen of Poland]] (1664–1688) that these are false. There was only one boy, found in the forests in spring 1663 and then brought to Poland's capital.<ref name="Aroles2007" />{{rp|196}}
===Raised with sheep===
An Irish boy brought up by sheep, reported by [[Nicolaes Tulp]] in his book ''Observationes Medicae'' (1672).<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|20–1}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" /><ref>{{Cite book| first = Nicolaas | last = Tulp | title = Observationes medicae | volume = IV | chapter = IX. Iuvenis Balans | publisher = Apud Ludovicum Elzevirium | year = 1652| location = Ghent | pages = 311–13 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=U7tbAAAAQAAJ&pg=PT313#v=onepage}}</ref> [[Serge Aroles]] gives evidence that this boy was severely disabled and exhibited for money.<ref name="Aroles2007">{{Cite book | first = Serge | last = Aroles | title = L'énigme des enfants-loups : une certitude biologique mais un déni des archives, 1304-1954 | publisher = Publibook | year = 2007| location=Paris | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=J-fjWToCMo0C&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage | isbn=2-7483-3909-6}}</ref>{{rp|199–201}}
A fourteen-year-old boy also known as the sheep boy, was found in the former Soviet Union living in a sheep flock. He was raised by sheep for 8 years. He had no communication skills and could not use the toilet. His parents left to find work and was left with his grandmother. His grandmother took care of him until she passed away.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/world/138467/Boy-raised-by-sheep-for-8-years|title=Boy raised by sheep for 8 years|last=Fagge|first=Nick|date=2009-11-06|work=Express.co.uk|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en}}</ref>
===Raised with cattle=== The [[Bamberg]] boy – who grew up among cattle (late 16th century).<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|18–9}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" />
===Raised by goats=== Daniel, Andes Goat Boy (1990) lived in the wild for about 8 years. He was discovered in the mountains of Peru and was raised by goats. He walked and ran on all fours with the mountain goats. He drank goat's milk, ate berries, and roots.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dawn.com/news/1325240|title=Raised by animals|last=Hussain|first=Fida|date=2017-04-08|work=DAWN.COM|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-US}}</ref>
===Raised by ostriches=== The "ostrich boy" – A boy named Hadara was lost by his parents in the Sahara desert at the age of two, and was adopted by [[common ostrich|ostriches]]. At the age of 12, he was rescued and taken back to society and his parents. He later married and had children. The story of Hadara is often told in west [[Sahara]]. In 2000, Hadara's son Ahmedu told his father's story to the Swedish author Monica Zak, who compiled it to a book.<ref>Zak M, [http://www.opal.se/bokbig/9789172991989.jpg ''Pojken som levde med strutsar''], Opal Förlag, 2003.</ref> The book is a mixture of the stories told by Ahmedu and Zak's own fantasy.<ref>Zak M, "[http://www.natverkstan.net/vastsahara/gamla_nr/nr3_4_01/mote_harads_son.html Möte med Hadaras son]", ''Västsahara'', nr. 3-4/2001 (in swedish).</ref>
===Other documented cases=== [[File:Kaspar hauser.jpg|right|thumb|[[Kaspar Hauser]].]] Jean de [[Liège|Liege]]. Described by natural philosopher Sir [[Kenelm Digby]] in his book 'Two Treatises' (1644).
The girl of [[Oranienburg]] (1717).<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|29–31}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber">{{cite book |url=https://archive.org/details/childchildhoodin00chamuoft |title=The Child and Childhood in Folk-Thought |accessdate=2018-02-08 |first=Alexander F. |last=Chamberlain |publisher=Macmillan and Co. |date= 1896}}</ref>
The two [[Pyrenees|Pyrenean]] boys (1719).<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|32}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" />
[[Peter the Wild Boy]] of [[Hamelin]] (1724)<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|32–41}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" /> – Mentally handicapped boy, affected with [[Pitt-Hopkins Syndrome]]. He lived only one year in the wild.
[[Marie-Angelique Memmie Le Blanc]], was a famous feral child of the 18th century in France who was known as The Wild Girl of Champagne, The Maid of Châlons, or The Wild Child of Songy. Marie-Angélique survived for ten years living wild in the forests of France, between the ages of nine and 19, before she was captured by villagers in Songy in Champagne in September 1731. She was likely born in 1712 as a Native American of the Meskwaki (or "Fox") people, and brought to France in 1720;<ref>{{cite book |last1=Aroles |first1=Serge |title=Marie-Angélique : Haut Mississippi, 1712-Paris, 1775 : survie et résurection d'une enfant perdue dix années en forêt |publisher=Terre-éd |isbn=2915587019}} {{ISBN|9782915587012}}.</ref> or she was born in an unknown location in 1721.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Hecquet |title=Histoire d'une jeune fille sauvage trouvée dans les bois à l'âge de dix ans |publisher=Gallimard |isbn=2072729831}}</ref> Marie died in Paris in 1775. Documents show that she learned to read and write as an adult, thus making her unique among feral children.
Hany Istók (a.k.a. Steve of the Marsh) of Kapuvár, Hungary (1749). According to documents stored at the Catholic parish of Kapuvár, an abandoned child was once found in a marshy lakeside forest by two fishermen. He was brought to the town of Kapuvár, where he was christened and received the name Steven. The local governor took him to his castle and tried to raised him up, but the boy eventually escaped and ran back to the forest. Later, numerous folk tales developed around his character, depicting him as a "half fish, half human creature" who lived in a nearby lake.<ref>[http://www.kapuvar.hu/varos/hanyistok/], "Hany Istók legendája" (Legend of Hany Istók)</ref>
[[Kaspar Hauser]] (early 19th century), portrayed in the 1974 [[Werner Herzog]] film ''[[The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser]]'' (''Jeder für sich und Gott gegen alle'').<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mysteriouspeople.com/Hauser1.htm |title=The Unsolved Mystery of Kaspar Hauser – Wild Child of Europe |accessdate=2007-07-14 |author=Brian Haughton |publisher=Mysterious People}}</ref>
Ramachandra (1970s and 1980s) – First reported in 1973 in the Indian state of [[Uttar Pradesh]], at roughly 12 years old, and as living an [[amphibian]] lifestyle in the Kuano river. He was rescued in 1979 and taken to a nearby village. He only partly adapted to a conventional lifestyle, still preferring raw food, walking with an awkward gait, and spending most of his time alone in nearby rivers and streams. He died in 1982 after approaching a woman who was frightened by him, and who badly scalded Ramachandra with boiling water. Historian [[Mike Dash]]<ref>Dash, Mike Borderlands: The Ultimate Exploration of the Unknown; Overlook Press, 2000, {{ISBN|0-87951-724-7}}.</ref> speculates that Ramachandra's uncharacteristically bold approach to the woman was sparked by a burgeoning sexual attraction coupled with his ignorance of cultural mores and taboos.
[[Cambodian jungle girl]] (2007) – Alleged to be Rochom P'ngieng, who lived 19 years in the Cambodian jungle.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/6275623.stm |title='Wild Cambodia jungle-girl' found |accessdate=2007-07-14 |date=2007-01-19 |publisher=BBC News }}</ref> Other sources questioned these claims.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2007/jan/23/jonathanwatts.features11 | journal=The Guardian | location=London | title=Wild child? | first=Jonathan | last=Watts | date=2007-01-23 | accessdate=2010-05-02}}</ref>
Name Unknown, [[Uzbekistan]], (2007) – Found after eight years.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.rian.ru/world/20070301/61418355.html |title=Boy found in Uzbekistan after eight years of animal existence |accessdate=2007-07-14 |date=2007-03-01 |publisher=Russian News & Information Agency }}</ref>
Ng Chhaidy, Theiva near [[Saiha]], [[Mizoram]], India (2012) – She went missing in a jungle aged four, returning 38 years later.<ref>{{cite web|last=Ruhani Kaur,|first=Lhendup G Bhutia|title=Mizoram’s Wild Flower|url=http://www.openthemagazine.com/article/nation/mizoram-s-wild-flower|journal=Open Magazine|accessdate=2012-08-20}}</ref>
== Alleged cases of feral children == ===Raised by pumas=== Vicente Caucau (1948) – Chilean boy found in a savage state at age 12, allegedly raised by pumas.<ref>Vicente Pizarro, [http://www.theclinic.cl/2010/01/02/los-ultimos-dias-de-vicente-cau-cau-el-nino-lobo-chileno/ ''Los ultimos dias de Vicente Cau Cau, el nino lobo chileno''], The Clinic, 2 de enero de 2010 (in spanish).</ref>
===Raised with sheep=== The historian [[Herodotus]] wrote that Egyptian [[pharaoh]] [[Psammetichus I]] (Psamtik) sought to discover the [[origin of language]] by conducting an experiment with two children. Allegedly, he gave two newborn babies to a shepherd, with the instructions that no one should speak to them, but that the shepherd should feed and care for them while listening to determine their first words. The hypothesis was that the first word would be uttered in the root language of all people. When one of the children cried “''bekos''” (a sound quite similar to the bleating of sheep) with outstretched arms the shepherd concluded that the word was [[Phrygian language|Phrygian]] because that was the sound of the Phrygian word for bread. Thus, they concluded that the Phrygians were an older people than the Egyptians.<ref>{{cite web| last=Herodotus| first=| authorlink=| others=George Rawlinson (translator)| title=The History of Herodotus| work=| publisher=| url=http://classics.mit.edu/Herodotus/history.2.ii.html| doi=| accessdate=November 29, 2009}}</ref>
===Other alleged cases===
The Lobo Wolf Girl of [[Devils River (Texas)|Devil's River]] (1845) – A figure in [[Texas]] folklore, was captured in 1846, but escaped. She was last spotted at age 17 in 1852.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Bertillion|first1=L. D.|title=The Lobo Girl of Devil's River|journal=Straight Texas|date=1937|volume=XIII|publisher=[[Texas Folklore Society]]|editor1-last=[[J. Frank Dobie|Dobie, J. Frank]]|pages=79–85|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=L_YTmqQZ7v4C&pg=PA56&lpg=PA56#v=onepage&q=The%20Lobo%20Girl%20of%20Devil's%20River}}</ref>
==Raised in confinement== Isabelle (1938) was almost seven years old when she was discovered. She had spent the first years of her life isolated in a dark room with her deaf-mute mother as her only contact. Only seven months later, she had learned a vocabulary of around 1,500 to 2,000 words. She is reported to have acquired normal linguistic abilities.<ref>{{cite book | last=Clark | first=E. V. | title=First Language Acquisition | year=2016 | publisher=Cambridge University Press |page=413}}</ref><ref>{{cite book | last=Cole | first=W. E. | title=Social Foundations of education | year=1968 | publisher=American Book Company |page=115}}</ref>
[[Anna (feral child)|Anna]] (1938) was six years old when she was found, having been kept in a dark room for most of her life.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://christopherjwwilkins.wordpress.com/2011/10/21/a-case-study-into-social-isolation-annas-story/|title=A case study into social isolation – Anna’s story|date=2011-10-21|work=The Thoughts and Ramblings of a Mad Man|access-date=2017-10-12|language=en-US}}</ref> She was born in March 1932 in [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. She was her mother's second illegitimate child. Her mother had tried to give Anna up for several months but no agency was willing to take the financial burden, as this was during the [[Great Depression]]. Anna was kept in a store room at least until she was five and half, out of the way of her disapproving grandfather, who was infuriated by her presence. Her mother also resented her, considering her troublesome. She was tied to a broken chair which was too small for her, and is believed to have also been tied to a cot for long periods of time. She was mostly fed milk and was never bathed, trained, or caressed by anyone. When she was found, she was suffering from [[malnutrition]] as well as [[muscle atrophy]]. She was immobile, expressionless, and indifferent to everything. She was believed to be deaf as she did not respond to others (later it was found that her deafness was functional rather than physical). She could not talk, walk, feed herself, or do anything that showed signs of cognition. Once she was taken away and placed in a foster home, she showed signs of improvement. At the age of nine she began to develop speech. She had started to conform to social norms and was able to feed herself, though only using a spoon. Her teachers described her as having a pleasant disposition. Anna passed away in August 1942 of hemorrhagic [[jaundice]].
[[Genie (feral child)|Genie]], discovered 1970 in Los Angeles. Confined to one room and abused by her father for 13 years.{{sfn|Reynolds|Fletcher-Janzen|2004|p=428}}<ref name="abcnews">{{cite web|url=http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=news/national_world&id=6130233|title=Wild Child 'Genie': A Tortured Life|last=James|first=Susan Donaldson|date=May 7, 2008|publisher=ABCnews.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130423023727/http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=news%2Fnational_world&id=6130233|archivedate=April 23, 2013|deadurl=no|accessdate=March 4, 2013|df=}}</ref><ref name="nova">{{cite episode|title=Secret of the Wild Child|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/transcripts/2112gchild.html|accessdate=February 12, 2009|series=[[Nova (TV series)|NOVA]]|network=PBS (United States), [[BBC]] (United Kingdom)|season=22|number=2|publisher=[[PBS]]|airdate=March 4, 1997|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121109103309/http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/transcripts/2112gchild.html|archivedate=November 9, 2012|deadurl=no|oclc=57894649}}</ref>
Sujit Kumar (1979), named the “Chicken Boy of Fiji” by the media, was born with cerebral palsy and epilepsy. Sujit's mother committed suicide when he was a toddler and his father left him confined under the house to live with the chickens. Sujit was rescued while still a boy and committed to the Samabula Old People's Home where he was confined to his room and tied to his bed. He could not speak and his only verbalisation was clucking; his only interaction with people consisted of outbursts. Sujit remained at the old people's home for 20 years until he was found by Elizabeth Clayton, a wealthy businesswoman who founded the Happy Home Trust to care for Sujit and other at risk Fijian children. Sujit's behaviour has improved, but he will never learn to speak and he remains profoundly disabled.<ref>{{Skeptoid|id=4567|number=567|title=Feral Children|accessdate=25 April 2017}}</ref>
Danielle Crockett, [[Plant City, Florida]], United States (2007–2008), had been locked in her room and deprived of any human interaction for the first 7 years of her life, causing a variety of severe developmental delays. She was found and adopted and is currently undergoing efforts to acclimate her to human conditioning including learning English and effective communication. As of 2017, Dani now lives in a group home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tampabay.com/features/humaninterest/article750838.ece|title=The Girl in the Window|last=DeGregory|first=Lane|date=2008-08-04|publisher=''[[St. Petersburg Times]]''|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120204162200/http://www.tampabay.com/features/humaninterest/article750838.ece|archivedate=2012-02-04|accessdate=2008-08-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tampabay.com/specials/2008/reports/danielle/|title=The Girl in the Window|author=DeGregory|first=Lane|author2=Melissa Lyttle|accessdate=2008-08-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dispatch.com/content/stories/national_world/2008/08/10/1A_FERAL_--_PART_1.ART_ART_08-10-08_A1_DHAVPL6.html|title=The Girl in the Window: Authorities Had Discovered the Rarest and Most Pitiable of Creatures: A Feral Child.|last=DeGregory|first=Lane|date=2008-08-10|accessdate=2008-08-17|registration=yes|journal=[[The Columbus Dispatch]]}}</ref>
Vanya Yudin, ("Russian bird boy"), Russia, (2008), a seven-year-old boy was found who spent his entire life living in a tiny two bedroom apartment surrounded by birds. His mother never spoke to him and treated him as a pet, and when found he was unable to communicate except for chirping and flapping his arms like wings.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1580159/Russian-bird-boy-discovered-in-aviary.html|title=Russian 'bird-boy' discovered in aviary|last=Cockcroft|first=Lucy|date=2008-02-28|accessdate=2013-09-27|publisher=Telegraph}}</ref>
Natasha, [[Chita, Zabaykalsky Krai]], Russia (2009), a five-year-old girl who spent her entire life locked in a room with cats and dogs, and no heat, water, or sewage system.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article6373089.ece|title=Feral girl in Siberian city of Chita was brought up by cats and dogs|author=Tony Halpin|date=May 27, 2009|journal=Times|author2=Jenny Booth|location=London}}</ref><ref name="planetark">{{cite news|url=http://planetark.org/wen/53118|title=Russian Police Find Feral Girl In Siberia|date=2009-05-28|publisher=[[Planet Ark]]}}</ref> When she was found, she could not speak, would jump at the door and bark as caretakers left, and had "clear attributes of an animal".<ref name="planetark" />
== Hoaxes == Following the 2008 disclosure by Belgian newspaper ''[[Le Soir]]''<ref>{{cite web |url=http://archives.lesoir.be/?action=nav&gps=580849 |title=Les aveux de Misha Defonseca}}</ref> that the bestselling book ''[[Misha: A Mémoire of the Holocaust Years]]'' and movie ''Survivre avec les loups'' (“''Surviving with Wolves”'') was a media [[hoax]], the French media debated the credulity with which numerous cases of feral children have been unquestioningly accepted. Although there are numerous books on these children, almost none of them have been based on archives; the authors instead have used dubious second- or third-hand printed information. According to the French surgeon [[Serge Aroles]], who wrote a general study of feral children based on archives (''L'Enigme des Enfants-loups'' or ''The Enigma of Wolf-children'', 2007), many alleged cases are totally fictitious stories: * The teenager of [[Braşov|Kronstadt]] (1781)<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|49–55}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://etd.lib.fsu.edu/theses/available/etd-04112005-153758/unrestricted/11_Chapter2_deal.pdf |title=Chapter 2: Feral Children and Wranitzky’s Pantomime-Ballet Das Waldmädchen (1796) |accessdate=2007-06-18 |last=Deal |first=Bama Lutes |date=2005-04-01 |format=PDF |work=The Origin and Performance History of Carl Maria von Weber's Das Waldmädchen (1800) |publisher=[[Florida State University]] |page=16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070701003432/http://etd.lib.fsu.edu/theses/available/etd-04112005-153758/unrestricted/11_Chapter2_deal.pdf |archive-date=2007-07-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> – According to the [[Hungarian language|Hungarian]] document published by [[Serge Aroles]], this case is a hoax: the boy, mentally handicapped, had a [[goitre]] and was exhibited for money. * Syrian Gazelle Boy (1946) – A boy aged around 10 was reported to have been found in the midst of a herd of [[gazelle]]s in the [[Syria]]n desert in the 1950s, and was only rescued with the help of an [[Iraqi army]] jeep, because he could run at speeds of up to 50 km/h. However, it was a hoax, as are the other gazelle-boy cases. * [[Amala and Kamala]] – Claimed to have been found in 1920 by missionaries near [[Midnapore]], [[Calcutta]] region, [[India]], later proved to be a hoax to gain charity for Rev. Singh's orphanage.<ref name="Aroles2007"/>{{rp|104–113}} Scholars from Japan and France launched a new inquiry about Amala and Kamala, and validated the discoveries and conclusions done by Serge Aroles 20 years before: the story was a hoax.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Suzuki|first1=Kotaro|last2=Vauclair|first2=Jacques|title=De quelques mythes en psychologie : Enfants-loups, singes parlants et jumeaux fantômes|date=2016|publisher=Le Seuil|isbn=9782021103663|language=fr}}</ref> * Ramu, [[Lucknow]], India, (1954) – A girl taken by a wolf as a baby, and raised in the jungle until the age of seven.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/jungle-girl-mystery-deepens/2007/01/21/1169330767618.html |title=Naked man deepens mystery of jungle girl |accessdate=2007-07-14 |date=2007-01-22 |publisher=The Sydney Morning Herald }}</ref> [[Serge Aroles|Aroles]] made inquiries on the scene and classifies this as another hoax. * The bear-girl of [[Krupina]], [[Slovakia]] (1767)<ref name="Rauber" />{{rp|48–9}}<ref name="Rauber_in_Chamber" /> – Serge Aroles found no traces of her in the Krupina archives.
== Legend, fiction, and popular culture == {{Main|List of fictional feral children}} Myths, legends, and fiction have depicted feral children reared by wild animals such as [[Gray wolf|wolves]], [[ape]]s, [[monkey]]s, and [[bear]]s. Famous examples include [[Romulus and Remus]], [[Ibn Tufail]]’s [[Hayy ibn Yaqdhan|Hayy]], [[Ibn al-Nafis]]’ [[Ibn al-Nafis#Theologus Autodidactus|Kamil]], [[Rudyard Kipling]]’s [[Mowgli]], [[Edgar Rice Burroughs]]’s [[Tarzan]], [[George of the Jungle]] and the legends of [[Atalanta]] and [[Enkidu]].
[[File:She-wolf suckles Romulus and Remus.jpg|thumb|The [[Capitoline Wolf]] suckling [[Romulus and Remus]].]] Roman legend has it that [[Romulus and Remus]], twin sons of [[Rhea Silvia]] and [[Mars (mythology)|Mars]], were suckled by a [[She-wolf (Roman mythology)|she-wolf]]. Rhea Silvia was a priestess, and when it was found that she had been pregnant and had children, King [[Amulius]], who had usurped his brother's throne, ordered her to be buried alive and for the children to be killed. The servant who was given the order set them in a basket on the [[Tiber river]] instead, and the children were taken by [[Tiberinus (god)|Tiberinus]], the river god, to the shore where a she-wolf found them and raised them until they were discovered as toddlers by a shepherd named [[Faustulus]]. He and his wife [[Acca Larentia]], who had always wanted a child but never had one, raised the twins, who would later feature prominently in the events leading up to the founding of Rome (named after Romulus, who eventually killed Remus in a fight over whether the city should be founded on the [[Palatine Hill]] or the [[Aventine Hill]]).<ref>{{cite web | last = Plutarch | authorlink = | others = John Dryden (translator) | title = Romulus | url = http://classics.mit.edu/Plutarch/romulus.html | doi = | accessdate = November 29, 2009}}</ref>
Legendary and fictional children are often depicted as growing up with relatively normal [[Intelligence#Human intelligence|human intelligence]] and skills and an innate sense of culture or civilization, coupled with a healthy dose of [[Self preservation|survival instincts]]. Their integration into human society is made to seem relatively easy. One notable exception is Mowgli, for whom living with humans proved to be extremely difficult.
The subject is treated with a certain amount of realism in [[François Truffaut]]’s 1970 film ''[[L'Enfant Sauvage|L’Enfant Sauvage]]'' (UK: ''The Wild Boy'', US: ''[[The Wild Child]]''), where a scientist's efforts in trying to rehabilitate a feral boy meet with great difficulty.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/897470428|title=François Truffaut : The Lost Secret|last=Gillain|first=Anne|publisher=Indiana University Press (Ind.)|year=2013|isbn=9780253008459|location=|page=215|translator-last=Fox|translator-first=Alistair,|oclc=897470428|quote=|via=}}</ref>

{{Infobox person | name = Frank P. Banta | image = Frank_P._Banta.jpg | alt = <!-- descriptive text for use by speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software --> | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1870|03|29}} | birth_place = [[New York, NY]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1903|11|30|1870|03|29}} | death_place = [[New York, NY]] | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = Pianist, Recording artist | years_active = 1890s-1900s | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Frank P. Banta''' (March 29, 1870 - November 30, 1903) was an American pianist and recording artist active in the 1890s and 1900s.
Banta was born in [[New York City]] to John William Banta and Frances Green Banta (Darrow)<ref>{{cite web |last1=Edwards |first1=Bill |title=Frank P. Banta |url=http://ragpiano.com/comps/fbanta.shtml |website=Ragpiano.com}}</ref>. He learned to play piano while working as a piano tuner<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Walsh |first1=Jim |title=Favorite Pioneer Recording Artists : Fred Van Eps |journal=Hobbies |date=January 1956 |page=32 |url=https://archive.org/stream/FavoritePioneerRecordingArtists/Favorite%20Pioneer%20Recording%20Artists#page/n502/mode/1up}}</ref>, and by 1893 was the house pianist for the New York Phonograph Company (a subsidiary of the [[North American Phonograph Company]]).<ref>{{cite news |title=Singing to the Cylinders |url=https://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1893-06-25/ed-2/seq-5/ |work=New York Sun |date=June 25, 1893}}</ref> By December of the same year, he was leading "Banta's Parlor Orchestra" for the North American Phonograph Company.<ref>{{cite book |title=New Records Made by the North American Phonograph Company |date=December 1893 |publisher=North American Phonograph Co. |location=New York, NY |page=2 |url=http://edison.rutgers.edu/NamesSearch/SingleDoc.php?DocId=CA027G}}</ref> He recorded as a piano accompanist and as leader of "Banta's Orchestra" for [[Walcutt and Leeds]] by 1896, and may have done the same for Walcutt, Miller & Co., its predecessor, in the intervening years.<ref>{{cite book |title=Catalogue of New York Records for the Phonograph or Graphophone |date=1896 |publisher=Walcutt and Leeds |location=New York, NY |url=http://blog.dinosaurdiscs.com/post/166366962397/walcutt-leeds-1896}}</ref> Banta's Orchestra recorded 15 cylinders for the [[Columbia Phonograph Company]] in 1896.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Lorenz |first1=Kenneth |title=Two-Minute Brown Wax and XP Cylinder Records of the Columbia Phonograph Company |date=1981 |publisher=Kastlemusick |location=Wilmington, Del. |url=https://archive.org/details/KastlemusickColumbiaCylinders}}</ref> The [[Chicago Talking Machine Company]] also marketed recordings by Banta's Orchestra, though it's unclear whether they recorded them or duplicated records taken by another company.<ref>{{cite book |title=The Talking Machine Company [catalog] |date=c. 1897 |publisher=Chicago Talking Machine Company |location=Chicago, Ill.}}</ref>
The bulk of Frank P. Banta's recording activity was as the house pianist of Edison's [[National Phonograph Company]]. His death notice in the company's trade paper ''Edison Phonograph Monthly'', noted "His were the hands that played the piano accompaniments to more than half of the records in the Edison catalogue".<ref>{{cite journal |title=Frank P. Banta |journal=Edison Phonograph Monthly |date=January 1904 |volume=1 |issue=11 |page=4 |url=https://archive.org/stream/edisonphonograph01moor#page/n169/mode/1up}}</ref> He also recorded for Edison one solo of his own composition, "Violets" (Edison Gold Moulded no. 8394).<ref>{{cite web |title=Violets (Frank P. Banta) |url=https://archive.org/stream/edisonphonograph01moor#page/n169/mode/1up |website=UCSB Cylinder Audio Archive |publisher=UC Santa Barbara Library}}</ref> He recorded three sides for [[Victor Talking Machine Company|Victor]] in September 1903, one piano solo ([[Hello! Ma Baby]]) and two accompaniments for cornetist [[Herbert L. Clarke]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Frank P. Banta (instrumentalist : piano) |url=https://adp.library.ucsb.edu/index.php/talent/detail/1313/Banta_Frank_P._instrumentalist_piano |website=Discography of American Historical Recordings |publisher=UC Santa Barbara Library}}</ref>
Banta was an early adopter and proponent of [[ragtime]] and his accompaniments are some of the earliest recorded examples of the style. He was also regarded as a reliable powerhouse, who could play the same pieces many times over before mass-duplication of records was reliably available. In addition to his recording work, Banta composed at least 14 pieces between 1895 and 1903, primarily ragtime piano solos or popular songs, and arranged the famous "Laughing Song" popularized by [[George W. Johnson (singer)|George W. Johnson]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Edwards |first1=Bill |title=Frank P. Banta |url=http://ragpiano.com/comps/fbanta.shtml |website=Ragpiano.com}}</ref>
Frank P. Banta was the father of the somewhat more famous pianist Frank E. Banta, who recorded prolifically between 1916 and 1939, especially for [[Victor Talking Machine Company|Victor]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Frank E. Banta (instrumentalist : piano) |url=https://adp.library.ucsb.edu/index.php/talent/detail/1312/Banta_Frank_E._instrumentalist_piano |website=Discography of American Historical Recordings |publisher=UC Santa Barbara Library}}</ref> Frank P. Banta died in New York aged 33 after an extended period of poor health.<ref>{{cite journal |title=Frank P. Banta |journal=Edison Phonograph Monthly |date=January 1904 |volume=1 |issue=11 |page=4 |url=https://archive.org/stream/edisonphonograph01moor#page/n169/mode/1up}}</ref>
==Compositions==
*Wheelmen's Patrol (1895) *Wheeling, Wheeling (or Love a Wheel) (1895) *She's a Pretty Lass (1896) *Olga: Waltzes (1897) *On the Housatonic (1897) *The Chaser: Two Step (1897) *Say You'll Be Mine in a Year, Love (1897) *Dancing on the Dock (1897) *Ragged William: A Darkey's Idea of the William Tell Overture in Rag-time (1899) *Kareless Koon (1899) *Halimar: Oriental Rondo (1901) *The Town Pump: Characteristic March (1902) *Sonoma: Dance (1903) *Dimpled Dolly Daisy Day (1903)

[[Chess]] is played all over the world. The international governing body of chess is [[FIDE]], established in 1924. Most national chess federations are now members of FIDE; several supranational chess organizations are also affiliated with FIDE.
