revision.text:
This page is a '''glossary of Colombian music'''. {{main|Music of Colombia}} {{AlphanumericTOC| align=center| nobreak=| numbers=| externallinks=| top=|}}
==A== * '''agüelulo''' - A teenage gathering, originally held in private homes and then larger spaces; a teenager who frequented such a place was a ''agüelero'' or sometimes a ''cocacolos'', after the main beverage drunk at ''agüelulos'', [[Coca-Cola]]<ref name="Waxer">{{cite book|title=The City of Musical Memory: Salsa, Record Grooves, and Popular Culture in Cali, Colombia|author=Wazer, Lise A.|publisher=Wesleyan University Press|location=Middletown, Connecticut|year=2002|isbn=0-8195-6441-9}}</ref> * '''música andina''' - An early national style of the 19th and early 20th centuries, developed from the Andean interior<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[música antillana]]''' - A kind of popular dance music based on Cuban and Puerto Rican styles<ref name="Waxer"/> * ''audición'': literally ''listening'', can refer to a "special musical tribute to the career of a particular artist or group", performed before the beginning of a concert<ref name="Waxer"/>
==B== * '''baile''' - Literally, ''dance'', dances are alphabetized under their descriptor, e.g. ''baile de cuota'' is alphabetized under ''cuota'' * '''[[bambuco]]''' - An Andean style of dance music, perceived as a national music in the early 20th century,<ref name="Rough Guide">Burton, Kim. "El Sonido Dorado". 2000. In Broughton, Simon and Ellingham, Mark with McConnachie, James and Duane, Orla (Ed.), ''World Music, Vol. 2: Latin & North America, Caribbean, India, Asia and Pacific'', pp 372-385. Rough Guides Ltd, Penguin Books. {{ISBN|1-85828-636-0}}</ref> or an Andean lyric music performed along with ''pasillo'' as a common part of the ''música andina'' repertoire<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''balada''' - In popular music, refers to a kind of "Spanish romantic popular music", found across Latin America<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''bandola''' - A stringed instrument similar to a [[mandolin]], used in ''[[Llanero#Llanero culture|llanera]]''<ref name="Rough Guide"/> and ''musica andina''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''bandolin''' - A larger relative of the ''bandola''<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''bingo bailable''' - a dance that includes [[Bingo (U.S.)|bingo]] games and [[salsa music]]<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[bolero]]''' - A loose term for love [[ballad]]s<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''bombo''' - A drum used in folklore groups on the Atlantic coast, laid with sticks and used to start a performance by calling on the other drums to perform;<ref name="Rough Guide"/> a bass drum used in traditional ''cumbia'' ensembles<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[bugalú]]''' - An early form of New York salsa, popular in Colombia during the 1960s, a fusion of ''[[son (music)|son]] with [[rhythm and blues]]<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''bullerengue''' - A ''Costeño'' form, performed by flute-and-drum ensembles<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''The Colombian Mambo''-the Colombian men would go to clubs and dance with each other until their legs fell off.
==C== * '''[[caja vallenata]]''' - A ''[[vallenato]]'' drum originally made from goatskin<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''calle de las salsotecas''' - Literally, ''salsoteca street'', referring to ''Calle 44'', a three-mile-long road in Cali, referring to the numerous ''salsotecas'' and ''tabernas'' along the street, known for featuring ''[[salsa dura]]'' and Cuban music during the 1980s and 90s<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''caballo''' - A rhythmic pattern played on the [[conga]]<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''camaján''' - An alternate term for the ''pachuco''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''campana''' - A [[Cowbell (instrument)|cowbell]]<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''campanero''' - A performer of the cowbell, notably played by audience members along with the on-stage performer<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''capachos''' - [[Maraca]]s<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''música caribeña''' - A rarely used synonym for ''música antillana''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''carrilera''' - A form of guitar-based music from the [[Antioquia Department|Antioquia]] province, associated "with the urbanizing peasant or working class"<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''carrito''' - Small, streetside vendors of recorded music<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''carrizo''' - A form of Colombian folk [[flute]]<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''caseta''' - A dance hall<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''cencerro''' - A [[timbales]] cowbell<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[champeta]]''' - A form of rootsy music from the Atlantic coastal city of [[Cartagena, Colombia|Cartagena]], where an Afro-Colombian population developed the style;<ref name="Rough Guide"/> an Afro-Colombian style associated with Cartagena and [[Barranquilla]], which combines elements of [[African pop]], [[soca music|soca]], [[zouk]], [[mbaqanga]] and [[soukous]]<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''champús bailable''' - A Caleño tradition of house parties, which began in the 1930s and were usually held on Sundays;<ref name="Waxer"/> ''champú'', a beverage made from pineapple, corn, bitter orange leaves and a fruit called ''lulo''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''chandé''' - A Costeño'' form, performed by flute-and-drum ensembles<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[chirimía]]''' - A kind of ensemble found in the northwest corner of [[Chocó Department|Chocó]] province<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''chucu-chucu''' - An alternate term for ''raspa''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''cokacolo''' - A teenage dancer at a ''agüelulo''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[contrapunteo]]''' - An improvised, verbal duel<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''música colombiana''' - ''Colombian music'', formerly understood to refer to ''música andina'' in the 19th and early 20th century, when that style was perceived as a national music * '''baile de cuota''' - A type of dance party in Cali's working-class neighborhoods during the mid-20th century<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[Cuatro (instrument)|cuatro]]''' - A small [[guitar]], used in ''[[Llanero#Llanero culture|llanera]]''<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''[[currulao]]''' - A [[marimba]]-based music found along the southwest littoral [[Valle del Cauca Department|Valle]], [[Cauca Department|Cauca]] and [[Nariño Department|Nariño]] provinces of Colombia, as well as [[Esmeraldas Province|Esmeraldas]] in [[Ecuador]]<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[cumbia]]''' - A form of nation music, originally from the Atlantic coast and characterized by a "solidly grounded and complex layered rhythm with an airily syncopated melody"<ref name="Rough Guide"/>
==E== * '''empanada bailable''' - An alternate term for ''champú bailable'', referring to the ''[[empanada]]''s often served
==F== * '''[[fandango]]''' - A ''Costeño'' song form, performed by flute-and-drum ensembles<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''festivales''' - Community dances in Cali, held in neighborhood dance halls or pavilions<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''fiesta patronales''' - Saints days<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''flauto de millo''' - See ''millo, flauto de''
==G== * '''[[Kuisi|gaita]]''' - A folk [[flute]];<ref name="Rough Guide"/> a ''Costeño'' form, performed by flute-and-drum ensembles;<ref name="Waxer"/> ''conjunto de gaita'' is a traditional ''cumbia'' ensemble<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''guabina''' - A kind of ''música andina''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[guacharaca]]''' - A [[Güiro|scraper]], common in ''[[vallenato]]'' * '''guache''' - [[Rattle (percussion instrument)|Rattle]]s made from filling metal or gourd tubes with seeds<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''guateque''' - Originally a Cuban word referring to a rural ''campesino'' party, which came to refer to a form of ''[[salsa dura]]'', characterized by "slow, grinding ''[[son montuno]]''s with heavy bass and percussion; associated also with ''[[El guateque de la salsa]]'' (''The Salsa Party''), a popular radio show from 1989 to 1993<ref name="Waxer"/>
==I== * '''música de la interior''' - An Andean style, often used synonymously with ''[[bambuco]]'', characterized by a gentle and melodic sound and a well-developed melody at the expense of rhythmic complexity<ref name="Rough Guide"/>
==J== * '''[[joropo]]''' - Originally a folk dance performed in honor of saints days and other special occasions, such as birthdays and baptism;<ref name="Rough Guide"/> now more often a generic word for ''[[Llanero#Llanero culture|llanera]]'' based dance music;<ref name="Rough Guide"/> a [[courtship]] dance associated with central Colombia and that region's [[cowboy]] culture, a "dynamic, polyrhythmic mestizo style that fuses Andalusian, African and indigenous elements"<ref name="Waxer"/>
==K== * '''kiosco''' - A community pavilion, used for musical performances<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[kuisi]]''' - an indigenous [[flute]] made from a hollowed cactus stem, with a beeswax and charcoal powder mixture for the head, with a quill made from a goose or turkey feather for the mouthpiece. There are male and female versions of the pipe (or [[gaita (disambiguation)|gaita]] in Spanish), the female ''kuisi bunsi'' (or ''gaita hembra'') with 5 holes, and the male ''kuisi sigi'' (or ''gaita macho'') with two.<ref name="Sturman,2003">{{cite book|last1=Sturman|first1=Janet L.|authorlink1=Janet L.Thurman|editor1-first=Lysloff|editor1-last=René T.A.|editor1-link=René T.A. Lysloff|editor2-first=Gay|editor2-last=Leslie C.|editor2-link=Leslie C. Gay|title=Music and technoculture|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MPRBF1wqmcoC|accessdate=2009-08-16|edition=illustrated |year=2003|publisher=Wesleyan University Press|location=Middletown, Connecticut|language=|isbn=0-8195-6514-8| pages=153–180|chapter=Technology and Identity in Colombian Popular Music|chapterurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=MPRBF1wqmcoC&pg=PA153&lpg=PA154|ref=Sturman,2003}}</ref>
==L== * '''llamador''' - A drum, traditionally used in ''cumbia'' as well as modern ''música tropical''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[Llanero#Llanero culture|llanera]]''' - A form of [[harp]]-led music<ref name="Rough Guide"/>
==M== * '''[[marimbula]]''' - A low-pitched [[thumb piano]]<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''flauto de millo''' - A folk clarinet of the Atlantic coast<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''melómano''' - A "music aficionado"<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''música''' - Literally ''music'', music forms are alphabetized by their descriptor, e.g. ''música antillana'' is alphabetized under ''antillana''
==N== * '''música de negros''' - Literally ''black people's music'', a pejorative term used by the elite to deride musics such as ''música antillana''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''nueva ola''' - Literally ''new wave'', a kind of pop-''balada'' performed by romantic crooners, which peaked in the 1960s and 70s<ref name="Waxer"/>
==O== * '''orquesta''' - A dance band<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''orquesta femenina''' - An all-female dance ensemble<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''orquesta infantile''' - An all-child dance ensemble<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''orquesta juvenile''' - An all-youth dance ensemble<ref name="Waxer"/>
==P== * '''pachanga''' - An early form of New York salsa, popular in Colombia during the 1960s, especially in the city of [[Cali]]<ref>Waxer, pg. 92; Waxer cites the Cali claim to Helio Orovo, from personal communication on May 31, 1996</ref> * '''pachuco''' - An iconic figure, a "ruffian and a hustler... an antihero", especially important in the culture surrounding the ''[[Zona de tolerancia]]''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''parrandero''' - A typical lyrical focus of the more macho side of popular ''[[cumbia]]'', referring to a boasting, aggressive and sexual "party-going man"<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''[[pasillo]]''' - A lyric song form from the Andean region<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''el paso Caleño''' - A traditional dance step from the city of Cali, characterized by a "rapid 'double-time' shuffle on the tips of the toes"<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''pasta americana''' - ''Carrito'' slang referring to the thicker and higher quality vinyl of American records * '''picó''' - Derived from the English ''[[Pick up (music technology)|pickup]]'', a large [[Sound reinforcement system|sound system]] among [[DJ]]s in Cartagena and Barranquilla during the 1980s<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''pop tropical''' - A form of mid-1990s pop-salsa<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[porro]]''' - A music genre. A village [[brass band]];<ref name="Rough Guide"/> a song form performed by the flute-and-drum ensembles of the Atlantic coast region, as well as mid-20th century urban dance ''orquestas''<ref name="Waxer"/>
==R== * '''raspa''' - A simplied form of ''música tropical'' which emerged in the late 1960s<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''refajo''' - A street [[slang]] from the [[Zona de tolerancia]] in Cali<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[rock en español]]''' - Spanish language [[rock music]], most closely associated with the cities of [[Bogotá]] and [[Medellín]] in Colombia<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''rumba''' - Partying or merry-making, compare to ''rumbero'', a party<ref name="Waxer"/>
==S== * '''[[salsa music|salsa]]''' - A Spanish Caribbean dance music created in New York City using elements of Afro-Cuban and Puerto Rican music, a combination known in Colombia as ''[[musica antillana]]''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''salsíbiri''' - A term coined by [[Fruko]] to describe his own style<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''salsómano''' - A salsa fan<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''salsoteca''' - A venue that plays salsa * '''serenata''' - A pan-Latin tradition of street [[serenade]]s performed by small groups of instrumentalists, especially guitarists<ref name="Waxer"/>
==T== * '''tambor hembra''' - The lead frum of the Atlantic coast drum choirs<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''tambor macho''' - A [[conga]]-like drum that leads the basic rhythm of the Atlantic coast drum choirs<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''terapia''' - An alternate term for ''champeta''<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''musica tropical''' - A form of salsa-based music innovated by [[Joe Arroyo]];<ref name="Rough Guide"/> a form of dance music based on various Atlantic coast genres<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''[[tiple]]''' - A small stringed instrument, used in ''[[Llanero#Llanero culture|llanera]]''<ref name="Rough Guide"/> and ''musica andina''<ref name="Waxer"/>
==V== * '''[[vallenato]]''' - A form of accordion-based music, related to ''música tropical'' and ''cumbia'', and originally associated with the Atlantic Coast * '''vallenato-protesta''' - A form of ''[[vallenato]]''-based [[protest song]]<ref name="Rough Guide"/> * '''verbena''' - Free street parties held during the December [[Feria]] and sponsored by the city of Cali<ref name="Waxer"/> * '''viejoteca''' - Dance parties, originally appearing in 1993 for senior citizens but later appealing to middle-aged partygoers and finally abandoning any age restrictions; these ''viejotecas'' became associated with a revival of the ''agüelulos'' and nightclub scenes of the 1960s and 70s; originally from Cali, ''viejotecas'' have spread to Medellin and Cartagena<ref name="Waxer"/>
==Z== * '''[[zarzuela]]''' - [[Operetta]]s<ref name="Waxer"/>
==See also== * [[Music]]
== References== {{Reflist|35em}}
[[Category:Colombian music| ]] [[Category:Glossaries of music|Colombian music]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:iXIT Corporation}} {{Infobox company | name = iXIT Corporation | native_name = iXIT株式会社 | native_name_lang = jp | romanized_name = Kabushiki gaisha iXIT Kōporēshon | logo = IXIT Corporation logo.png | type = [[Kabushiki gaisha]]
[[Subsidiary]] | former_names = Index Corporation (2014-2016) | industry = [[Information and communications technology]] | foundation = April 1, 2014 | founder = | location_city = Taishidō, [[Setagaya, Tokyo|Setagaya]], [[Tokyo]] | location_country = [[Japan]] | key_people = Shunichi Nakaigawa {{small|(President and Representative Director)}}[http://www.sawada-holdings.co.jp/group/ Sawada Holdings Group] | products = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | num_employees_year = | parent = Sawada Holdings Co, Ltd. | subsid = | homepage = {{url|http://www.ixit.co.jp/}} }} {{Nihongo|'''iXIT Corporation'''|iXIT株式会社|[[Kabushiki gaisha]] iXIT Kōporēshon}}, formerly known as {{Nihongo|'''Index Corporation'''|株式会社インデックス|Kabushiki gaisha Indekkusu Kōporēshon}}, is a Japanese corporate [[information and communications technology]] company owned by Sawada Holdings. "Index Corporation" was a corporate name used by three different Japanese companies, between 1997 and 2016, the last one being founded in April 2014. All three incarnations of Index Corporation have been linked to the video game brand [[Atlus]] at one time or another. The original Index Corporation was founded in 1995 and acquired Atlus in 2006. It went bankrupt in June 2013 while still owning Atlus. In September 2013, [[Sega]] created the shell corporation Sega Dream Corporation with the sole intent of purchasing the assets of Index Corporation. Sega Dream was renamed Index Corporation in November 2013 and gained possession of Atlus' name and intellectual properties. In April 1, 2014, the new Index Corporation was renamed Atlus, but was amputated from its non-gaming business that Sega transferred the same day to a new company called Index Corporation. In 2015, Sega sold Index Corporation to Sawada Holdings. Index Corporation was renamed as iXIT Corporation in July 2016. ==History== {{Infobox company | name = Index Corporation | native_name = 株式会社インデックス | native_name_lang = jp | romanized_name = Kabushiki gaisha Indekkusu Kōporēshon | logo = Index Corporation logo.png | former_name = Index Holdings | type = [[Kabushiki gaisha]]
[[Subsidiary]] | industry = [[Information and communications technology]] | fate = Business operations taken over by [[Sega]]. Assets absorbed into [[Sega Dream Corporation]]. | foundation = {{Start date|1995|09|01}} | founder = | defunct = {{End date|2013|09|05}} | location_city = Taishido, [[Setagaya-ku]], [[Tokyo]] | location_country = [[Japan]] | key_people = Yoshimi Ochiai (President) | products = | revenue = {{¥|39.379 million}} | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | num_employees_year = | divisions = [[Atlus]] | subsid = [[Career Soft]]
Index Asia Ltd.
[[Atlus USA|Index Digital Media]] | parent = [[Sega|Sega Games Co, Ltd.]] | homepage = }} Index Corporation Ltd. was founded on 1 September 1995 as a mobile content service provider. It adopted the name of Index by 1997 and expanded into one of Japan's most successful companies, with acquisitions into several communications and entertainment ventures, including the [[anime]] studio [[Madhouse (company)|Madhouse]], game companies [[Atlus]] and [[Interchannel]], and major [[movie studio]] [[Nikkatsu]]. It also made inroads into numerous worldwide ventures, including the [[United States]], [[United Kingdom]] and [[France]], where it owned the football club [[Grenoble Foot 38]], which, upon Index's acquisition, achieved promotion to [[Ligue 1]].{{cite web|url=http://www.index-hd.com/group_news_english/?p=6|title=Grenoble Foot 38 celebrates the long awaited opening of its new professional soccer stadium, `Stade des Alpes`|publisher=Index Corporation|accessdate=26 January 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/69MpVjJEW?url=http://www.index-hd.com/group_news_english/?p=6|archivedate=23 July 2012|df=}} Up to 2013, Index Corporation had sold most of its subsidiaries. In June 2013, following investigations for fraud, Index Corporation was forced to file for civil rehabilitation bankruptcy. On November 9, 2010, Index Holdings (株式会社インデックス・ホールディングス) announced its renaming to Index Corporation (株式会社インデックス), to be confirmed on the 15th shareholders meeting on 25 November 2010, effective on 1 December 2010.[http://www.index-hd.com/press/uploads/140120101109061772.pdf 商号変更および定款一部変更に関するお知らせ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102033803/http://www.index-hd.com/press/uploads/140120101109061772.pdf |date=2013-11-02 }}{{cite web|title=Index Holdings to Change Company Name|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/4835.OS/key-developments/article/2018369|publisher=Reuters|date=9 November 2010|accessdate=23 September 2012}} On June 27, 2013, following an investigation for fraud,{{cite web|title=Atlus parent company files for Bankruptcy|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/06/27/atlus-parent-company-files-for-bankruptcy/|publisher=Siliconera|date=27 June 2013}} Index Corporation filed for [[reorganization|civil rehabilitation]] [[bankruptcy]] due to a debt consisting of 24.5 billion yen.{{cite web|title=ATLUS’ Mother Company Index Corporation Files for Bankruptcy|url=http://www.dualshockers.com/2013/06/27/atlus-mother-company-index-corporation-files-for-bankruptcy/|publisher=Dual SHOCKERS|date=27 June 2013}}{{cite web|title=Atlus Games' Index Corporation Files for Civil Rehabilitation Bankruptcy|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2013-06-27/atlus-games-index-corporation-files-for-civil-rehabilitation-bankruptcy|publisher=Siliconera|date=27 June 2013}}[http://indexweb.jp/assets/files/shared/pdf/disclose/2013/130627-01.pdf 民事再生手続開始の申立てに関するお知らせ] On September 18, 2013, it was reported that [[Sega Sammy Holdings]] had won a bid to acquire Index for 14 billion yen.{{cite news|title=Sega Said to Win Auction to Buy Bankrupt Japan Gamemaker Index|author=Shigeru Sato & Takahiko Hyuga|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-09-18/sega-said-to-win-auction-to-buy-bankrupt-japan-gamemaker-index.html|publisher=Bloomberg|date=18 September 2013|accessdate=18 September 2013}} Sega Sammy Holdings denied taking over Index Corporation at first,[http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2013-09-18/nikkei/sega-sammy-to-buy-out-atlus-games-index-corporation Nikkei: Sega Sammy to Buy Out Atlus Games' Index Corporation] however it announced later that day that Index Corporation would sell the digital game business, contents and solution business, and amusement business to Sega Dream Corporation (株式会社セガドリーム), a subsidiary of Sega Corporation established on September 5, 2013 effective on November 1, 2013. The sales covered fixed assets and intellectual property assets of the announced operations, which included Atlus Holding, Inc. (parent company of Index Digital Media, Inc.), Tiger Mob Limited, Index Corp (Thailand) Ltd., Mobi Town Ltd. However, liabilities including interest-bearing debts would not be taken over.[http://sega.jp/corp/release/2013/0918/ 株式会社インデックスの事業譲受けに関する契約締結について][http://sega.jp/corp/release/2013/0918/nr130918_2.pdf 株式会社インデックスの事業譲受けに関する契約締結について]{{cite web|url=http://www.segasammy.co.jp/english/pdf/release/20130918_index_e_final.pdf|title=Notice of Conclusion regarding Business Transfer Agreement of Index Corporation|publisher=Sega Sammy Holdings Inc.|date=18 September 2013|accessdate=18 September 2013|format=PDF}} On November 1, 2013, Sega announced that it will rename its subsidiary, Sega Dream Corporation, to Index Corporation (株式会社　インデックス).{{cite web|url=http://sega.jp/corp/release/2013/1101/ |script-title=ja:当社子会社の事業譲受に関するお知らせ |language=Japanese |publisher=Sega Corporation |date=1 November 2013 |accessdate=2 November 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131106081214/http://sega.jp/corp/release/2013/1101/ |deadurl=yes |archivedate=6 November 2013 |df= }} On February 18, 2014, Sega and Index Corporation announced the separation of Index Corporation's contents and solution businesses into a new subsidiary under the name 'Index Corporation' (株式会社インデックス), while renaming the 'old' Index Corporation and its remaining digital game business division into 'Atlus' (株式会社アトラス), effective on April 1, 2014. The new Atlus would also include the foreign subsidiary Index Digital Media, Inc., which would be renamed to Atlus U.S.A., Inc. at the effective establishment day of the new Atlus.[http://indexweb.jp/assets/files/shared/pdf/disclose/2014/140218-02.pdf 会社分割（新設分割）及び商号変更に関するお知らせ][http://sega.co.jp/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/nr140218_1.pdf 連結子会社の会社分割（新設分割）及び商号変更に関するお知らせ] On May 28, 2014, Masami Ochiai, Chairman of the former Index Corporation, and his wife Yoshimi Ochiai, president of the company, were arrested by the Tokyo District Public Prosectors Office on suspicion of falsifying stock reports for the company.2014-06-17 [http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2014/06/17/national/crime-legal/heads-failed-game-developer-index-corp-indicted-fraud/#.V4aqsrgrLIU.html Heads of failed game developer Index Corp. indicted for fraud] On December 1, 2015, as part of a structural reform within the [[Sega Sammy Holdings]] group, Sega Holdings sold its shares of Index Corporation to the insurance and financial company, Sawada Holdings. Through this business transfer, Index Corporation became a wholly owned subsidiary of Sawada Holdings.{{cite web|url=http://www.segasammy.co.jp/english/pdf/release/20151127_kogaisha_e_final.pdf|title= Notice of Conclusion of Transfer Agreement of Subsidiary’s Shares (Index Corporation) by Subsidiary (SEGA Holdings Co., Ltd.)|publisher=Sega Sammy Holdings|date=27 November 2015|accessdate=22 March 2017|format=PDF}} On July 1, 2016, Index Corporation changed its name to iXIT Corporation.{{cite web|url=http://www.ixit.co.jp/files/corporate_20160627155719.pdf?20160705134851|title=Company Name Change - Index Corporation|publisher=Sawada Holdings|date=27 June 2016|accessdate=27 June 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160821182407/http://www.ixit.co.jp/files/corporate_20160627155719.pdf?20160705134851|deadurl=yes |archivedate=2016-08-21|format=PDF}} ==Index Asia Ltd== [[File:Index Corp 2014 logo.png|thumb|The logo for the reformed Index Corporation under [[Sega]]. This logo is currently used by Index Asia Ltd.]] Index Asia Ltd., formerly known as Index Corporation Thailand Ltd., is a mobile content and service provider in Thailand that was established in April 2002. Once Index Corporation Thailand Ltd. was amalgamated with Mobi Town Ltd., and Tiger Mob Ltd., the company was re-branded as Index Asia Ltd.[https://web.archive.org/web/20160706220351/http://www.indexasia.co.th/news/47 Establishment of Index Asia Ltd. from the amalgamation process] They are a subsidiary of iXIT Corporation that provides mobile software application, licensing and application development services within Thailand. Index Asia Ltd. has a distinctive business structure with three primary services, the Game Publishing & Game Management Services: the service dedicated to video game development and publishing, the Application Development & Solution Provider: the services dedicated to original mobile application developments, and the Mobile Content Aggregator & Provider Services: the services dedicated to mobile content and licensing distribution.[http://www.indexasia.co.th/business Index Asia Ltd, Business Structure] Index Corporation Thailand Ltd., was renamed to Index Asia Ltd. effective 1 July 2015. This was achieved through an amalgamation of Index Corporations remaining subsidiaries: Mobi Town Ltd. and Tiger Mob Ltd. being absorbed into Index Corporation Thailand Ltd. and the surviving company being renamed to Index Asia Ltd. The process was accomplished in the Ministry of Commerce of Thailand.[http://www.indexasia.co.th/sitemap Index Asia Ltd, Corporate History] On December 1, 2015, when the Sega Holdings group sold its shares of Index Corporation to Sawada Holdings, Index Asia Ltd. was transferred over alongside Index Corporation. == Former subsidiaries == {|style="width:100%;" class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !scope="col" style="width:30%;"|Name !scope="col" style="width:28%;"|Purpose !scope="col" style="width:20%;"|Outcome !scope="col" style="width:4%;" |Ref. |- !scope="row"|Index Magazines Corporation (株式会社インデックス・マガジンズ) |Magazine Subsidiary. |Absorbed into Index Communications Corporation effective 22 August 2005. |[http://www.index-hd.com/press/?p=145 インデックス、戦略的なCI確立に向けてグループ子会社3社の社名を変更、出版部門2社を合併] |- !scope="row"|[[Nikkatsu Corporation]] (日活株式会社) |Japanese motion picture subsidiary. |Transferred to SKY Perfect Communications Inc. effective December 2005. |[http://www.index-hd.com/press/?p=134 日活株式一部譲渡のお知らせ][http://www.sptvjsat.com/pdf/newsSPC/en/051130_SP_nikkatu_en.pdf Acquisition of Nikkatsu Corporation Shares] |- !scope="row"|Style Index Co., Ltd. {{Blacklisted-links|1= *http://cuetracker.net/players/john-virgo/career-total-statistics *:''Triggered by \bcuetracker\.net\b on the local blacklist'' *http://www.cuetracker.net/pages/players.php?ID=3556&season=1993/1994 *:''Triggered by \bcuetracker\.net\b on the local blacklist'' *http://www.cuetracker.net/pages/tournaments.php?ID=680 *:''Triggered by \bcuetracker\.net\b on the local blacklist''|bot=Cyberbot II|invisible=false}} {{Infobox snooker player | name = John Virgo | image = John Virgo crop.jpg | caption = Virgo in 2003 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1946|3|3|df=y}} | birth_place = [[County Borough of Salford|Salford]], [[Lancashire]], England | Sport country = {{ENG}} | Nickname = Mr Perfection, JV | Professional = 1976–1995 | High ranking = 10 ([[Snooker world rankings 1979/1980|1979/80]]) | Current rank = | Prize money = [[Pound sterling|£]]293,472{{cite web|url=http://cuetracker.net/players/john-virgo/career-total-statistics|title=CueTracker - Career Total Statistics For John Virgo - Professional Results - Snooker Results & Statistics|website=cuetracker.net}} | High break = 139 {{small|([[English Professional Championship|1987 English Professional Championship]])}} | Century break = 39 | Best finish = Semi-final (4 times) | Ranking wins = | Other wins = 4 }} '''John Virgo''' (born 3 March 1946 in [[County Borough of Salford|Salford]], [[Lancashire]]) is an English former professional [[snooker]] player and more recently a snooker [[sports commentator|commentator]] and [[television|TV]] personality. ==Career as snooker player== ===Early professional career (1973–1978)=== Virgo’s first notable appearance in a major tournament was during the 1973 American Pool Tournament for [[The Indoor League]] where he lost in the semi final. Virgo turned professional in 1976, at a time when players such as [[Ray Reardon]], [[John Spencer (snooker player)|John Spencer]] and [[Eddie Charlton]] were at the forefront of the sport. Although he had just turned 30 upon turning pro, he was still among the youngest players on the circuit at the time. In 1977 Virgo reached the semi finals of the [[1977 UK Championship (snooker)|UK Championship]] losing to eventual winner [[Patsy Fagan]]. ===UK Champion and Top 10 player (1979–1990)=== His snooker-playing fortunes peaked in 1979 when he reached the semi-final of the [[1979 World Snooker Championship|World Championship]], and went on to win the [[1979 UK Championship (snooker)|1979 UK Championship]] (though this was not a ranking event at the time). En route to the final Virgo beat [[Tony Meo]], [[Steve Davis]] and [[Dennis Taylor]]. In the final he overcame the reigning world champion [[Terry Griffiths]] despite being controversially docked two frames because of a miscommunication regarding the start time of the next session of play.{{cite web|url=http://www.surreylife.co.uk/people/celebrity-interviews/big_break_star_john_virgo_on_trick_shots_snooker_legends_and_his_cobham_home_1_3231591|title=Big Break star John Virgo on trick shots, snooker legends and his Cobham home|last=Wintle|first=Angela|date=11 January 2014|publisher=Surrey Life|accessdate=11 March 2016}} He reached the Top 10 in the world rankings the following season. In 1986 Virgo reached the semi finals of the [[British Open (snooker)|British Open]] losing 9-4 to [[Willie Thorne]].{{cite web|url=http://www.cuetracker.net/pages/tournaments.php?ID=680|title=CueTracker - 1986 British Open - Snooker Results & Statistics|work=cuetracker.net}} Virgo, ending the 1989–1990 season as world number 14, dropped out of the top 16 next season. ===Later career and retirement (1991–1995)=== In 1993 Virgo entered the qualifying stages of the [[World Open (snooker)|Grand Prix]] and the [[UK Championship (snooker)|UK Championship]] but failed to qualify for the main events, losing both times in round seven.{{cite web|url=http://www.cuetracker.net/pages/players.php?ID=3556&season=1993/1994|title=CueTracker - John Virgo - Season 1993-1994 - Snooker Results & Statistics|work=cuetracker.net}} Virgo retired from professional play in 1995. ==Career as exhibition player and TV commentator== Virgo, as part of his exhibition performances, had long performed [[trick shot]]s and comedic impressions of other snooker players. During the [[1981 World Snooker Championship|1981 World Championship]], he performed some of his impressions, including [[Alex Higgins|Alex 'Hurricane' Higgins]], [[Steve Davis]] and [[Ray Reardon]]. He repeated this act in further World Championships, usually after semi-finals ended earlier than expected. He is now a TV snooker commentator who works primarily during the [[BBC]]'s coverage of ranking events. From 1991 to 2002, Virgo was co-presenter of the snooker-based TV [[game show]] ''[[Big Break]]'' with [[Jim Davidson (comedian)|Jim Davidson]]. During each show, Virgo participated in the "[[trick shot]]s" segment, where a competitor who had been ousted from the main quiz would try to copy a complicated snooker shot performed by Virgo in order to win a prize. Virgo is well known for shouting "where's the {{cuegloss|cueball}} going?" during his commentaries if a player plays a shot in such a way that the cueball gets in any sort of proximity to a pocket. Virgo would also similarly say another ball in place of the cueball, if another ball is {{cuegloss|fluked}}, or very close to the pocket. ==Other activities== Virgo's tribute book to the late [[Alex Higgins]], ''Let Me Tell You About Alex'', was published in February 2011 and described as "explosive".{{cite news|title=John Virgo: My life in the eye of Hurricane Higgins|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/local-national/northern-ireland/john-virgo-my-life-in-the-eye-of-hurricane-higgins-15067267.html|accessdate=2012-12-17|newspaper=Belfast Telegraph|date=29 January 2011}} In April 2012, his book ''Amazing Snooker Trick Shots'' was published. In 2012 Virgo featured in Nicholas Gleaves' debut radio play Sunk who guides a young man in his dream of becoming a snooker champion while battling to avoid a life of crime. This was broadcast on BBC Radio 4 Virgo has recently{{when|date=May 2014}} worked with a pool and snooker table company called [[Liberty Games]] to create a web-based series of trick shot videos known as the Trick Shot Academy.{{cite web |url=http://www.libertygames.co.uk/trick-shot-academy/ |title=Trick Shot Academy|author= |date= |work= |publisher=[[Liberty Games]] |accessdate=7 October 2011}} In 2014 Virgo released a trick shot app, ''John Virgo's Snooker Trick Shots'', available on Apple and Android devices. It has Virgo performing 45 trick shots and contains diagrams and video clips for each. It also has Alex 'Hurricane' Higgins performing three trick shots including 'Higgins Goes Bananas'. Virgo is currently embarking on a new venture, opening a new vegan cafe, Virgo's Vegan Cafe, in his home city of Salford, with help from fellow snooker player and friend Peter Ebdon. ==Personal life== John Virgo lives in [[Cobham, Surrey|Cobham]] Surrey. He has two children, a son Gary from his first marriage and a daughter Brook Leah from his second marriage. He separated from his second wife, Avril, in 1991, after 18 years together.{{cite news|last=Cassidy|first=Denis|title=I'M BIG BROKE; Ex-wife's fury as snooker ace Virgo cuts payments.|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/I%27M+BIG+BROKE%3B+Ex-wife%27s+fury+as+snooker+ace+Virgo+cuts+payments.-a0109548051|accessdate=2012-12-17|newspaper=The People|date=2 November 2003}} In 2009, he married Rosie Ries, then deputy managing director at John Blake Publishing. Virgo was once [[gunge]]d on ''[[Noel's House Party]]''. Virgo is a fan of the football club [[Manchester United F.C.]]. In 1996 he appeared as a celebrity contestant on the short-lived Saturday night BBC light entertainment show ''Full Swing'', alongside [[John Lodge (musician)|John Lodge]] from [[The Moody Blues]] and former Tottenham goalkeeper [[Pat Jennings]]; he did not make the final. ==Performance and rankings timeline== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" |- style="background:#efefef;" ! revision.comment: Fixed lead and put list in correct order.
revision.text:
'''Jon Winokur''' (born August 5, 1947) is an American writer and editor.
Born in [[Detroit]], the son of Martin M. and Elinor Winokur, he attended [[Temple University]] (BA, 1970) and the [[University of West Los Angeles]] (JD, 1980).<ref>Curt Johnson and Frank Nipp, ''Who's Who in Writers, Editors & Poets: United States & Canada, 1992-1993'' (December Press, 1992: {{ISBN|0-913204-22-6}}), p. 574.</ref>
== Books == *MasterTips (Potshot Press, 1985). *Writers on Writing (Running Press, 1986) *The Portable Curmudgeon (NAL, 1987) *Zen to Go (NAL, 1988) *A Curmudgeon’s Garden of Love (NAL, 1989) *Friendly Advice (Dutton, 1990) *Mondo Canine (Dutton, 1991) *True Confessions (Dutton, 1992) *The Portable Curmudgeon Redux (Dutton, 1992) *Fathers (Dutton, 1993) *Je Ne Sais What? (Dutton, 1995) *The Rich Are Different (Pantheon, 1996) *Happy Motoring (with Norrie Epstein; Abbeville, 1997) *Advice to Writers (Pantheon, 1999) *How to Win at Golf Without Actually Playing Well (Pantheon, 2000) *The Traveling Curmudgeon (Sasquatch, 2003) *The War Between the State (Sasquatch, 2004) *Encyclopedia Neurotica (St. Martin’s, 2005) *In Passing (Sasquatch, 2005) *Ennui to Go (Sasquatch, 2005) *The Big Curmudgeon (Black Dog & Leventhal, 2007) *The Big Book of Irony (St. Martin’s, 2007) *The Garner Files: A Memoir (with James Garner; Simon & Schuster, 2011) *But Enough About Me: A Memoir (with Burt Reynolds; Putnam, 2015)
== References == <references/>
== Sources ==
*"L.A.'s Viceroy of Vitriol: Profile of Jon Winokur," by Garry Abrams, ''Los Angeles Times'', January 15, 1990.
== External links == *"[https://twitter.com/AdviceToWriters Jon Winokur on Twitter]" *“[http://www.latimes.com/news/opinion/commentary/la-oe-winokur-vin-scully-20110331,0,1322287.story With Dodgers Announcer Vin Scully, It's Always More Than Pleasant Good]” *"[http://blog.guykawasaki.com/2006/09/ten_questions_w.html#ixzz15agcTPeThttp://blog.guykawasaki.com/2006/09/ten_questions_w.html#axzz15agbFQV0 Ten Questions with Jon Winokur: How to Heighten Your Sense of the Absurd]" *"[http://articles.latimes.com/2007/feb/11/opinion/op-winokur11 You Call That Irony?]" *"[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jon-winokur/advice-to-writers-books_b_700945.html#s133073 Advice To Writers: The Best Books On Writing Books]" *"[https://web.archive.org/web/20120405223037/http://scottholleran.com/blog/20111108-interview-jon-winokur Interview with Jon Winokur by Scott Holleran]" *[http://www.AdviceToWriters.com AdviceToWriters.com]"
{{DEFAULTSORT:Winokur, Jon}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Jewish American writers]] [[Category:Jewish comedy and humor]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Writers from Detroit]] [[Category:American humorists]]

{{italic title}} '''''Kramers Ergot''''' is a series of anthology-style books of comic art edited by [[Sammy Harkham]]. ==Publication history== ''Kramers Ergot'' started as a mini-comic self-published by Sammy Harkham under the imprint [[Avodah Books]]. Issues 4 and 5 were published by [[Gingko Press]], while issues 6 and 7 were published by [[Buenaventura Press]]. Published in November 2008, ''Kramers Ergot'' 7 features almost 60 artists and is larger (16" by 21") and more expensive ($125) than previous editions.[http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=18404 "''Kramers Ergot'' 7 Anthology Debuts at SPX''], [[Comic Book Resources]], October 10, 2008. An eighth volume was released in January 2012 from [[PictureBox]]. A ninth volume was released in April 2016 from [[Fantagraphics Books]]. ==Reception== A Quimby's blog item promoting multiple touring artists said: ''Kramers Ergot'' has been favorably reviewed and placed on numerous "best of the year" lists, including ''[[L.A. Weekly]]'', ''[[Dazed & Confused (magazine)|Dazed & Confused]]'', the ''[[Comics Journal]]'', and ''[[Publishers Weekly]]''. [http://quimbys.com/blog/store-events/sammy-harkham-kevin-huizenga-anders-nilsen-at-quimbys/ "Sammy Harkham, Kevin Huizenga, & Anders Nilsen at Quimby's!" Quimby's Quimblog (Mar. 4, 2006).] ==Issues and contributors== {| class="wikitable" border=1 cellpadding="5" width="100%" |- bgcolor="#ffebcd" align="center" ! width="50"|Issue ! width="150"|Publisher,
Date,
ISBN ! Contributors |- align="center" | 1 |Avodah Books
Spring 2000
48 pp. | Includes work by [[Sammy Harkham]], [[Justin Howe]], [[David Brook (comics)|David Brook]], and Luke Quigley. |- align="center" | 2 | Avodah Books
Spring 2001
| Includes work by [[Sammy Harkham]], [[Justin Howe]], [[David Brook (comics)|David Brook]], and Luke Quigley. |- align="center" | 3 | Avodah Books
December 2002 | Includes work by [[Mark Burrier]], [[Ben Jones (comics)|Ben Jones]], [[Sara Varon]], [[Stefan Gruber]], [[Kathleen Lolley]], [[Neil Fitzpatrick]], [[Joe Grillo]], [[Hans Rickheit]], [[Zack Soto]], [[Luke Quigley (comics)|Luke Quigley]], [[Mat Tait (comics)|Mat Tait]], and [[Sammy Harkham]]. |- align="center" | 4 | Avodah Books (2003) {{ISBN|0-9677989-5-7}}
Reissued by Gingko Press (2004)

Reissued by Buenaventura Press (2008) {{ISBN|0-9800039-7-0}} | Includes work by [[Mat Brinkman]], [[Renee French]], [[Anders Nilsen (cartoonist)|Anders Nilsen]], [[Leif Goldberg]], [[Lauren Weinstein (comics)|Lauren Weinstein]], [[Marc Bell (cartoonist)|Marc Bell]], [[Allison Cole]], [[Christopher Forgues|C.F.]], [[Jim Drain]], [[Tobias Schalken]], [[Billy Grant]], [[Andrew Brandou]], Josh Simmons, [[Geneviève Castrée]], [[Joe Grillo]], [[David Heatley]], [[Dave Kiersh]], [[Souther Salazar]], [[Laura Grant]], [[Stefan Gruber]], [[David Lasky]], Ben Jones, [[Jeffrey Brown (comics)|Jeffrey Brown]], [[Ron Regé, Jr.]], [[John Hankiewicz]], and many more.[http://www.gingkopress.com/_cata/_grap/kramer4.htm ''Kramer's Ergot'' Four]

[http://www.popimage.com/content/viewnews.cgi?newsid1080706657,83713, Review of ''Kramers Ergot'' 4.] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060220120652/http://www.buenaventurapress.com/KE6/ ''Kramers Ergot'' 6] at Buenaventura Press * [http://www.time.com/time/columnist/arnold/article/0,9565,831415,00.html Review of ''Kramers Ergot'' 5], [[Time (magazine)|Time]] * [http://www.tcj.com/index.php?Itemid=70&id=414&option=com_content&task=view Review of ''Kramers Ergot'' 6], [[The Comics Journal]] [[Category:Comics publications]] [[Category:Comics anthologies]] {{comics-stub}}

{{Infobox TV channel |name = Massaya TV |logofile = Massaya TV Logo.png |logosize = |logoalt = |logo2 = |launch = |share = |share as of = |share source = |network = |owner = |slogan = |country = [[Syria]] |language = [[Arabic language|Arabic]] |broadcast area = Syria
[[Arab World]]
[[Europe]] |affiliates = |headquarters = [[Damascus]] |former names = |replaced names = |replaced by names = |sister names = |timeshift names = |web = [http://www.massayacom.com www.massayacom.com] |sat serv 1 = [[Eutelsat|Eutelsat 7 West A]] |sat chan 1 = 10796 V – 27500 - 5/6 |online serv 1 = |online chan 1 = }} '''Massaya TV''' (Arabic قناة مسايا الفضائية) is a private Syrian satellite [[television station]] based in [[Damascus]] and in [[Dubai]]. It is specializing in broadcasting events, concerts and weddings particular in [[Syria]] and the Arab World. Massaya TV offers also interviews with specialists in beauty and make-up and also specialists in art lighting and photography. ==Programs== One of the most important programs produced by the channel in Syria are: * Massaya al-Kheir Suriya (مسايا الخير سوريا) * Al-Afrah wa Al-Araas (Weddings and Weddings, الافراح والاعراس) * Akhbar Faan min Suriya (Art News from Syria, أخبار فن من سوريا) * Hafalat Ayad el-Milad wa el-Munasabat (Christmas concerts and events, حفلات اعياد الميلاد والمناسبات) The channel also produces programs in Egypt like: * Marah fi Farah (مرح في فرح) * Massaya al-Kheir min al-Qahira (مسايا الخير من القاهرة) * Al-Naharda Farahi (النهاردة فرحي) As well as programs of Dubai Events and Arab Weddings from different places. ==Station's offices== Massaya TV has many offices around the Arab World, most notably in [[Syria]], which is the main office and other offices are in [[Dubai]], [[Cairo]] and [[Lebanon]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.massayacom.com/ Massaya TV official website] {{ar icon}} {{Television in Syria}} [[Category:Arabic-language television stations]] [[Category:Television channels in Syria]] [[Category:Media in Damascus]] [[Category:Media in Dubai]] {{tv-stub}} {{Syria-stub}}

revision.text:
{{about|the film adaptation|the original novel|The Sea of Monsters}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox film | name = Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters | image = Percy-Jackson-Sea-poster.jpg | image_size = | border = | alt = | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Thor Freudenthal]] | producer = {{Plain list| * Karen Rosenfelt * [[Michael Barnathan]] }} | screenplay = [[Marc Guggenheim]] | based on = {{Based on|''[[The Sea of Monsters]]''|[[Rick Riordan]]}} | starring = {{Plain list| * [[Logan Lerman]] * [[Brandon T. Jackson]] * [[Alexandra Daddario]] * [[Jake Abel]] * [[Douglas Smith (actor)|Douglas Smith]] * [[Stanley Tucci]] <!-- per poster billing block --> }} | music = [[Andrew Lockington]] | cinematography = [[Shelly Johnson (cinematographer)|Shelly Johnson]] | editing = [[Mark Goldblatt]] | released = {{Film date|2013|08|07}} | runtime = 106 minutes<!--Theatrical runtime: 106:00--><ref>{{cite web | title = Percy Jackson: Sea Of Monsters | url = http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/percy-jackson-sea-monsters-film | work = [[British Board of Film Classification]] | accessdate = January 5, 2014 }}</ref> | studio = {{Plain list| * [[Fox 2000 Pictures]] * Sunswept Entertainment * [[1492 Pictures]] * [[TSG Entertainment]] }} | distributor = [[20th Century Fox]] | country = United States | language = English | budget = $90 million<ref name="mojo">{{cite web | url = http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=percyjackson2.htm | title = Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters | publisher = [[Box Office Mojo]] | accessdate = February 7, 2014}}</ref> | gross = $202.2 million<ref name=boxofficepro>{{cite web|url=http://pro.boxoffice.com/movie/16384/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters| title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters|publisher=[[proboxoffice]]|accessdate=February 1, 2014}}</ref> }}
'''''Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters''''' (also known as '''''Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Sea of Monsters''''') is a 2013 American [[Fantasy film|fantasy]] [[adventure film]] directed by [[Thor Freudenthal]]. It is the second installment in the [[Percy Jackson (film series)|''Percy Jackson'' film series]] and is based on the novel ''[[The Sea of Monsters]]'' by [[Rick Riordan]]. It is a stand-alone sequel to the 2010 film ''[[Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief]]''.
The film continues the adventures of [[Percy Jackson]] ([[Logan Lerman]]) and his friends, as they search for the [[Golden Fleece]] at the [[Bermuda Triangle|Sea of Monsters]]. [[Brandon T. Jackson]], [[Alexandra Daddario]], and [[Jake Abel]] reprise their roles from the previous film, while [[Nathan Fillion]] and [[Anthony Head]] replace [[Dylan Neal]] and [[Pierce Brosnan]]. New additions to the cast include [[Leven Rambin]], [[Douglas Smith (actor)|Douglas Smith]], and [[Stanley Tucci]]. The film was produced by [[Michael Barnathan]] and Karen Rosenfelt. [[Chris Columbus (filmmaker)|Chris Columbus]], who directed ''[[Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief]]'', serves as executive producer. The plot centers on Percy and his friends as they journey to the eponymous Sea of Monsters to retrieve the [[Golden Fleece]] in order to save the tree (barrier) that protects their home.
The film was released in North America on August 7, 2013, receiving mixed critical reviews and grossing around $200 million at the box office. The film was released on 3D Blu-ray, Blu-ray, and DVD on December 17, 2013.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://pro.boxoffice.com/statistics/movies/percy-jackson-the-olympians-sea-of-monsters-2012 |title=BoxOffice® — Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters |date=2014-12-20 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141220000132/http://pro.boxoffice.com/statistics/movies/percy-jackson-the-olympians-sea-of-monsters-2012 |archivedate=December 20, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
==Plot== <!-- PER WP:FILMPLOT, PLOT SUMMARIES FOR FEATURE FILMS SHOULD BE BETWEEN 400 AND 700 WORDS. --> While in Camp Half-Blood, Percy recounts the story of Thalia and her sacrifice. A young Annabeth, Luke, Grover and Thalia are running to Camp Half-Blood while being pursued by monsters. Thalia sacrifices herself to get the others into the camp, and her father [[Zeus]] turns her into a tree which forms a barrier around it.The campers realize that Thalia's tree has been poisoned by Luke and they are vulnerable to attacks. Percy visits the [[Oracle]], who tells him of a prophecy of a half-blood of the eldest gods either saving or destroying Olympus. Chiron tells Percy that he is the only living, human half-blood of the eldest gods, so the half-blood in the Prophecy may refer to him. Annabeth and Grover learn about the [[Golden Fleece]], which has the power to heal anything, and propose a quest in which they retrieve the Fleece and use it to heal Thalia's tree. Mr. D chooses Clarisse to lead the quest, much to Annabeth's and Percy's dismay. Percy convinces Grover and Annabeth to accompany him on the quest, and Tyson joins them. Annabeth hails the Chariot of Damnation, and Percy threatens the three drivers ([[the Graeae]]) to tell him of his prophecy, giving him coordinates for the Sea of Monsters (the [[Bermuda Triangle]]) before ejecting the group from the cab in Washington D.C. because they lack money. While walking down the street, Grover is kidnapped by Chris Rodriguez and taken to Luke. Percy, Annabeth, and Tyson first locate Luke with the help of [[Hermes]], then ride a [[Hippocampus (mythology)|Hippokampos]] to his yacht, the ''Andromeda''. Luke reveals his plan to revive [[Cronus|Kronos]] using the Fleece so Olympus will be destroyed. Percy and they are then locked in the brig, though they later escape when Percy uses his ability to manipulate water.
The group is consumed by [[Charybdis]], and they discover Clarisse in the monster's stomach. Percy and Clarisse work together to escape [[Charybdis]] by shooting a hole through its gut, and soon they arrive at Circeland, Polyphemus's lair. Percy finds Grover, and the five escape [[Polyphemus]], retrieving the fleece and trapping him in his cave. Afterwards, Luke arrives and demands the fleece from Percy, who refuses. Luke shoots a [[crossbow]] bolt at Percy, but Tyson takes the bolt in the chest and falls into the water below.
Luke begins reviving Kronos and Annabeth encourages Percy to take leadership. The team escapes captivity, and Percy grapples with Luke over the Fleece, like the prophecy said they would, but Luke easily gains the upper hand. Luke is suddenly thrown away by Tyson, revealed to have survived his wound due to the water healing it, as he is [[Poseidon]]'s son. Kronos rises from the sarcophagus and consumes Luke and Grover before battling Percy. Percy realizes that Riptide is the "cursed blade" of the prophecy and slices Kronos into pieces imprisoning Kronos in the sarcophagus once again, causing him to regurgitate Grover and Luke, the latter landing in Polyphemus's Lair. Their victory is short lived as Annabeth is stabbed by the [[Manticore]], who is killed in turn by Clarisse and Grover. Annabeth dies in Percy's arms but is resurrected by the Fleece. Percy then gives the fleece to Clarisse, and they return to Camp Half-Blood. Clarisse places the fleece on Thalia's tree. The group returns the next day to find Thalia alive, as the fleece returned her to human form.
Percy realizes that Thalia, as a child of Zeus, is another possible child of the prophecy about either preserving or destroying Olympus. The film ends showing the sarcophagus with Kronos's remains in it glowing, implying that Kronos still has some degree of his power, and is still planning to return.
==Cast/Characters== {{See also| List of Percy Jackson & the Olympians cast members}}
===Demigods=== * [[Logan Lerman]] as [[Percy Jackson]], the [[demigod]] son of [[Poseidon]].<ref name="Anthony Head Chiron" /> * [[Alexandra Daddario]] as [[Annabeth Chase]], the demigod daughter of [[Athena]], and Percy's secret crush.<ref name="Anthony Head Chiron" /> ** [[Alisha Newton]] portrays the younger Annabeth. * [[Douglas Smith (actor)|Douglas Smith]] as [[Tyson (Percy Jackson)|Tyson]], Percy's [[Cyclops]] [[Half-siblings|half-brother]].<ref name="Douglas Smith Negotiates Percy Sequel">{{cite web|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118050405|title='Percy' sequel zeroes in on Smith|accessdate=March 21, 2012}}</ref> * [[Leven Rambin]] as [[The Demigods|Clarisse La Rue]], the demigod daughter of [[Ares]].<ref name="ibtimes.com">{{cite web|url=http://au.ibtimes.com/articles/451671/20130329/logan-lerman-returns-percy-jackson-sea-monsters.htm#.UVc64_HMvaw |title=First Look: Logan Lerman Returns for ‘Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters’ with New Backup [PHOTOS] |work=International Business Times |date=March 29, 2013 |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref> * [[Brandon T. Jackson]] as [[Grover Underwood]], Percy's best friend and keeper, a [[satyr]].<ref name="Anthony Head Chiron" /> ** Bjorn Yearwood portrays the younger Grover. * [[Jake Abel]] as [[Luke Castellan]], the demigod son of [[Hermes]] and the main antagonist.<ref name="Anthony Head Chiron" /> ** Samuel Braun portrays the younger Luke. * [[Paloma Kwiatkowski]] as [[The Demigods#Thalia Grace|Thalia Grace]], the demigod daughter of [[Zeus]].<ref name=":0">{{cite web |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1854564/fullcredits |title=Full cast and crew for ''Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters'' (2013) |publisher=Internet Movie Database |accessdate=September 2, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Comingsoon March">{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=101853 |title=First Look at Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters |publisher=ComingSoon.net |date=March 21, 2013 |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref> ** [[imdbname:3393791|Katelyn Mager]] portrays the younger Thalia. * [[Grey Damon]] as Chris Rodriguez, a rogue demigod of unknown parentage who helps Luke to resurrect Kronos.
===Gods=== * [[Stanley Tucci]] as Mr. D / [[Dionysus]], the god of wine, celebrations, ecstasy, and theatre and director of Camp Half-Blood.<ref name="ibtimes.com" /> He was previously played by Luke Camilleri in the first film. * [[Nathan Fillion]] as [[Hermes]], Luke's father; the god of trade, thieves, travelers, sports, athletes, and messenger of the gods of [[Mount Olympus]].<ref name="Nathan Fillon Hermes">{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nathan-fillion-percy-jackson-sequel-hermes-300698 |title=Nathan Fillion to Play Hermes in 'Percy Jackson' Sequel |last=McClintock|first=Pamela |accessdate=March 21, 2012 |date=March 15, 2012}}</ref> He was previously played by Dylan Neal in the first film. ** [[Octavia Spencer]] as the voice of Martha, a [[snake]] that is in Hermes' caduceus. ** [[Craig Robinson (actor)|Craig Robinson]] as the voice of George, a snake that is in Hermes's caduceus. * [[Robert Knepper]] as the voice of [[Cronus|Kronos]], the King of the Titans, father of Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, Hestia, Demeter, Hera, Chiron, and Luke's master.
===Other characters=== * [[Anthony Head]] as [[Chiron]], the activities director at Camp Half Blood. Chiron is a [[centaur]] and the immortal son of [[Cronus|Kronos]] and brother of Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, Demeter, Hestia and Hera.<ref name="Anthony Head Chiron">{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/anthony-head-play-chiron-percy-302262 |title=Anthony Head to Play Chiron in 'Percy Jackson' Sequel |accessdate=March 28, 2013}}</ref> Chiron was previously played by [[Pierce Brosnan]] in ''[[Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief|The Lightning Thief]]''. * [[Robert Maillet]] as [[Polyphemus]] ** [[Ron Perlman]] as the voice of [[Polyphemus]] * Hunter Platin as Guard the Cyclops that is guarding the Golden Fleece.<ref name="Comingsoon March" /> * [[Shohreh Aghdashloo]] as the voice of [[Pythia|Oracle of Delphi]] * [[Missi Pyle]],<ref name="Comingsoon March" /> [[Yvette Nicole Brown]]<ref name="Comingsoon March" /> and [[Mary Birdsong]]<ref name="Comingsoon April">{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=102530 |title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters Moved up to August 7 |publisher=ComingSoon.net |date=April 6, 2013 |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref> as the [[Graeae]] * Jordan Weller as Ichneutae, the acolyte of Clarisse * [[Derek Mears]] and [[Aleks Paunovic]] as Cyclopes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://screencrush.com/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-photos-stanley-tucci/ |title='Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' First Look: Stanley Tucci in Leopard Print! |publisher=Screencrush.com |date=March 22, 2013 |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref> {{div col end}}
==Production== Reports of a second ''Percy Jackson'' film first surfaced in March 2011.<ref>[http://www.firstshowing.net/2011/percy-jackson-and-the-olympians-sequel-could-be-coming-soon/ 'Percy Jackson and the Olympians' Sequel Could Be Coming Soon?] First Showing. Retrieved July 31, 2013</ref><ref>[http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/movies/2011/03/percy-jackson-olympians-sequel-sea-monsters-riordan-logan-lerman.html 'Percy Jackson' sequel could be on its way] ''Los Angeles Times''. Retrieved July 31, 2013</ref> On October 12, 2011, a sequel was officially confirmed by [[20th Century Fox]].<ref>[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/fox-moves-new-die-hard-247435 Fox Moves Ahead With New 'Die Hard' and 'Percy Jackson' Films] ''The Hollywood Reporter''. Retrieved July 31, 2013</ref> [[Principal photography|Filming]] for ''Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters'' began on April 16, 2012. The film was originally going to be released on March 15, 2013,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Percy-Jackson-Sequel-Moves-Up-Calendar-7500-Disappears-30889.html |title=Percy Jackson Sequel Moves Up Calendar 7500 Disappears |last=O'Connell|first=Sean |work=Cinema Blend |accessdate=May 31, 2012}}</ref> but in May 2012, the release date was postponed to August 16, 2013.<ref name="Fox releases">{{cite web |url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/theplaylist/x-men-first-class-rise-of-the-planet-of-the-apes-sequels-set-for-summer-2014-20120531# |title='X-Men: First Class' & 'Rise Of The Planet Of The Apes' Sequels Set For Summer 2014; 'Independence Day 3D' Hits July 3, 2013 |publisher=indiewire.com |date=May 31, 2012 |accessdate=May 31, 2012}}</ref> In April 2013, a final release date was set for August 7, 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=102530 |title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters Moved up to August 7 |date=April 6, 2013 |publisher=ComingSoon.net |accessdate=August 10, 2013}}</ref> Filming took place in [[Robert Burnaby Park]] in [[Burnaby, B.C.]]; however from June 20 to July 22, they filmed in [[New Orleans]] for Princess Andromeda scenes,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://photos.nola.com/tpphotos/2012/07/percy_jackson_sea_of_monsters_4.html |title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters |publisher=Photos.nola.com |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref> including the former site of [[Six Flags New Orleans]].<ref name="SFNO">{{cite news |first=Mike|last=Scott |title=Abandoned Six Flags New Orleans site comes alive for 'Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' shoot |date=July 22, 2012 |publisher=NOLA.com |url=http://www.nola.com/movies/index.ssf/2012/07/abandoned_six_flags_new_orlean.html |accessdate=July 23, 2012}}</ref> More filming took place in January 2013. On January 22, 2013, [[Logan Lerman]] released a statement on [[Twitter]] that read "Last day of shooting on Percy Jackson 2" accompanied by a photo of the shooting.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/LoganLerman/status/293845904740466688 |title=LoganLerman: Last day of shooting on Percy |publisher=Twitter |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref>
===Development=== [[File:Logan Lerman on the set of Percy Jackson Sea of Monsters in Vancouver, May 2012.jpg|thumb|225x225px|Logan Lerman on the last day for the shooting of the film.]] In February 2011, it was revealed in the online subscription magazine ''Production Weekly'' that the film was in production.<ref>''Production Weekly'' issue 749, February 3, 2011</ref> In another source, the lead cast members from the first movie were expected to return for their roles. Chris Columbus would not be returning as director, though he would be producing the movie together with Karen Rosenfelt (producer of the ''Twilight'' movie ''Breaking Dawn''). Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski were hired as the scriptwriters.<ref>[http://pagetopremiere.com/2011/03/percy-jackson-sequel-the-sea-of-monsters-hires-screenwriter/ "‘Percy Jackson’ Sequel ‘The Sea of Monsters’ Hires Screenwriters"] PageToPremier.com. Retrieved September 13, 2013.</ref> [[Marc Guggenheim]] was hired to re-write the screenplay and Alexander and Karaszewski were uncredited. On June 16, 2011, it was announced that Thor Freudenthal would be directing the movie.<ref>"[http://collider.com/thor-freudenthal-percy-jackson-sequel/ Thor Freudenthal to Direct PERCY JACKSON AND THE OLYMPIANS: THE SEA OF MONSTERS; Logan Lerman Confirmed for Return]" Collider.com. Retrieved September 2013.</ref> Shooting began in summer 2012. On October 12, 2011, it was announced that the film would be released on March 26, 2013. On April 6, it was announced that the movie was pushed up to August 7, 2013.<ref>[http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=102530 "Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters Moved up to August 7"] ComingSoon.com. Retrieved September 13, 2013.</ref> On May 31, 2012, it was announced that the movie had been pushed back to August 16, 2013.<ref>[http://www.hypable.com/2012/05/31/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-release-date-pushed-back-several-months/ "‘Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters’ release date pushed back several months"] Hypable.com. Retrieved September 2013.</ref>
===Filming=== On January 13, 2012, a brand new production list was released and stated that filming would take place between April 26, 2012 and July 11, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dgcbc.com/productions.pdf{{cbignore}}|title=Directors Guild of Canada British Columbia|website=DGCBC.com|access-date=December 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.twitter.com/brandontjackson |title=Brandon T Jackson (brandontjackson) |publisher=Twitter |date= |accessdate=October 6, 2013}}</ref> It was filmed in Vancouver, British Columbia, and New Orleans, Louisiana, with the abandoned [[Six Flags New Orleans]] also serving as a filming location. Filming wrapped up in July and then started again in January for reshoots. It wrapped up on January 22, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|last=Stevens |first=Michael |url=http://www.sneakpeek.ca/2012/03/vancouver-film-production-update-april.html |title=Vancouver Film Production Update - April 2012 |publisher=Sneakpeek.ca |date=March 27, 2012 |accessdate=October 6, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nola.com/movies/index.ssf/2012/07/abandoned_six_flags_new_orlean.html |title=Abandoned Six Flags New Orleans site comes alive for 'Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' shoot |publisher=NOLA.com |date=July 2012 |accessdate=October 6, 2013}}</ref>
==Marketing== Five official stills were released on March 21, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hypable.com/2013/03/22/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-first-look-at-5-official-stills-from-the-upcoming-film/ |title='Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters': First look at 5 official stills |publisher=Hypable.com |date=March 22, 2013 |accessdate=July 7, 2013}}</ref> On April 2, the [[Trailer (promotion)|trailer for the film]] was uploaded on [[YouTube]]. A teaser poster was released on April 16. A second trailer was released on May 29, 2013. A third international trailer was released on the June 25, 2013, on YouTube. Since July 19, three TV spots have been released known as "Story", "Cast" and "Family". A clip from the film was released on the internet on July 23, where it was later uploaded onto YouTube. Later many more new clips were released.
[[Smart & Final]] stores in [[California]], [[Arizona]], and [[Nevada]] offered Hollywood Movie Money Certificate good for one free movie ticket with the purchase of two First Street Bakery items as part of the movie promotion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comicconfamily.com/free-percy-jackson-movie-ticket-smart-and-final/ |title=Free Percy Jackson Movie Ticket at Smart and Final |publisher=Comic Con Family |date=August 1, 2013 |accessdate=August 23, 2013}}</ref>
==Reception==
===Critical response=== The film received mixed reviews. The [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] reported a 41% approval rating with an average rating of 5.1/10 based on 111 reviews. The website's consensus reads, "It's pretty and packed with action; unfortunately, ''Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters'' is also waterlogged with characters and plots that can't help but feel derivative."<ref>{{cite web |title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters (2013) |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/percy_jackson_sea_of_monsters/ |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=4 March 2014 }} </ref> On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a normalized rating out of 100 based on reviews from critics, the film has a score of 39 based on 33 collected reviews, indicating "generally unfavorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.metacritic.com/movie/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters |title= Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters | publisher= [[CBS Interactive]] | work = [[Metacritic]] | accessdate = August 6, 2013}}</ref>
Jim Vejvoda of [[IGN]] rated the movie a 6 out of 10: "There are worse sequels than the CG-heavy ''Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters'', but it's just such overly familiar territory."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/08/06/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-review |title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters Review |date=August 6, 2013 |first=Jim |last=Vejvoda |publisher=IGN |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}</ref> Gary Goldstein of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' gave the film a positive review, saying that "tweens and young teens should be sufficiently distracted by the movie's brisk pace and heroic mayhem — if they're not too unnerved by its at times nightmarish imagery".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-percy-jackson-review,0,229247.story|title= Review: 'Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' a heroic effort for demigod|first=Gary|last=Goldstein|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=August 7, 2013|accessdate=August 7, 2013}}</ref> James Rocchi of [[ScreenCrush]] wrote that the film "is hardly the stuff of legend, but by keeping the plot straightforward and the storytelling clean, it's an odyssey the intended young audience will be glad to take."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://screencrush.com/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-review/ |title='Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' Review |publisher=ScreenCrush |first=James |last=Rocchi |date=August 6, 2013 |accessdate=August 12, 2013}}</ref> Marsha McCreadie on [[Roger Ebert|RogerEbert.com]] rated the film two and a half stars out of four, calling it "a gentler-spirited, less flashy enterprise, though it still presents a natural world that can morph at the whim of a god."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-2013|title= PERCY JACKSON: SEA OF MONSTERS|first=Marsha|last=McCreadle|work=[[Roger Ebert|RogerEbert.com]]|date=August 7, 2013|accessdate= August 7, 2013}}</ref>
Andy Webster of ''The New York Times'' commented: "''Sea of Monsters'' is diverting enough — the director, Thor Freudenthal ... is savvy with effects and keeps his young cast on point — but it doesn’t begin to approach the biting adolescent tension of the [[Harry Potter (film series)|''Harry Potter'' movies]]."<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/07/movies/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-with-logan-lerman.html | title = What a Hero Goes Through to Become a Healer ‘Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters,’ With Logan Lerman | newspaper=New York Times |accessdate = October 23, 2013}}</ref> However, Michael Rechtshaffen of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' criticized the film as "lack[ing] the energetic zip of its predecessor,"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/percy-jackson-sea-monsters/review/600345|title=Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters: Film Review|first=Michael|last=Rechtshaffen|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=August 7, 2013|accessdate= August 7, 2013}}</ref> while Bruce Ingram of ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]'' opined that "faithful fans of the novels will be unhappy with the liberties taken with the adaptation like they were with the first film."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.suntimes.com/entertainment/movies/21751751-421/thrills-lacking-in-percy-jacksons-second-film-mission.html |title=Thrills lacking in Percy Jackson’s second film mission|first=Bruce|last=Ingram|work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|date=August 6, 2013|accessdate= August 6, 2013}}</ref> Connie Ogle of ''[[The Miami Herald]]'' wrote, "[Are] these characters merely prisoners — much like the audience — of a script so uninspired that it demands their stupidity?"<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.miami.com/039percy-jackson-sea-monsters039-pg-article |title='Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' (PG) |work=[[Miami.com]] |first=Connie |last=Ogle |date=August 7, 2013 |accessdate=August 12, 2013}}</ref> Josh Bell of ''[[Las Vegas Weekly]]'' lambasted the series as a whole as "a thoroughly second-rate franchise ... with movies like ''Sea of Monsters'', it can probably continue in acceptable mediocrity for years to come".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lasvegasweekly.com/news/2013/aug/07/second-rate-franchise-percy-jackson/ |title=The second-rate franchise that is 'Percy Jackson'|first=Josh|last=Bell|work=[[Las Vegas Weekly]] |date=August 7, 2013|accessdate=August 12, 2013}}</ref>
===Box office=== ''Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters'' grossed an $68,559,554 in North America and $133,688,197 internationally for a worldwide total of $202,247,751.
The film grossed $5.4 million on its opening day, taking the number No. 2 spot at the domestic box office.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://boxofficemojo.com/daily/chart/?sortdate=2013-08-07&p=.htm | title=Daily Box Office for Wednesday, August 7, 2013 | publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] | accessdate=August 8, 2013}}</ref> During its extended five-day opening weekend the film debuted at the No. 4 spot and grossed $23,258,113.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3713&p=.htm |title=Weekend Report: Audiences Travel to 'Elysium' Over Crowded Weekend |publisher=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=August 12, 2013}}</ref>
===Accolades=== {| class="wikitable" rowspan="5;" style="text-align:center; background:#fff;" |- !Year!!Award!!Category!!Recipient(s)!!Result!!Ref. |- |[[35th Young Artist Awards|2014]]||[[Young Artist Award]]||[[35th Young Artist Awards#Best Performance in a Feature Film - Supporting Young Actress|Best Supporting Young Actress in a Feature Film]]||Katelyn Mager||{{nominated}}||<ref name="YAA35">{{cite web|url=http://www.youngartistawards.org/noms35.html |title=35th Annual Young Artist Awards |author= |date= |accessdate=April 14, 2014 |work=[[Young Artist Awards]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150720070434/http://www.youngartistawards.org/noms35.html |archivedate=July 20, 2015 |df= }}</ref> |- | [[2014 Kids' Choice Awards|2014]]||[[Kids' Choice Awards]]||Favorite Movie Hero: Percy Jackson||||{{nominated}}|| |}
==Soundtrack== {{Infobox album | name = Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters | type = Soundtrack | artist = [[Andrew Lockington]] | cover = | alt = | released = {{Start date|2013|8|6}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Soundtrack]] | length = 68:54 | label = [[Sony Classical]] | producer = [[Brian Liesegang]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} {{track listing | title1 = Thalia's Story | length1 = 3:42 | title2 = Percy at the Lake | length2 = 1:29 | title3 = Colchis Bull | length3 = 4:08 | title4 = The Shield is Gone | length4 = 1:31 | title5 = The Oracle's Prophecy | length5 = 3:08 | title6 = Cursed Blade Shall Reap | length6 = 1:43 | title7 = Wild Taxi Ride | length7 = 3:25 | title8 = Hermes | length8 = 2:34 | title9 = Hippocampus | length9 = 3:34 | title10 = Onboard the Yacht | length10 = 1:39 | title11 = Wave Conjuring | length11 = 6:49 | title12 = Sea of Monsters | length12 = 2:31 | title13 = Belly of the Beast | length13 = 3:52 | title14 = New Coordinates | length14 = 2:13 | title15 = Polyphemus | length15 = 2:58 | title16 = Thank You Brother | length16 = 6:01 | title17 = Kronos | length17 = 5:08 | title18 = Annabeth and the Fleece | length18 = 2:03 | title19 = Resurrection | length19 = 3:04 | title20 = Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters – Main Titles | length20 = 3:15 | title21 = To Feel Alive | note21 = composed by Andrew Lockington & Tiff Randol and performed by IAMEVE | length21 = 4:06 }} "[[My Songs Know What You Did in the Dark (Light Em Up)]]" by [[Fall Out Boy]] and "[[Cameo Lover]]" by [[Kimbra]] were featured in the movie but are unavailable on the soundtrack.
==Home media== The film was released on 3D Blu-ray, Blu-ray, and DVD on December 17, 2013. The film was additionally released for Digital HD download on December 3.<ref name="percyjacksonthemovie.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.percyjacksonthemovie.com/us/#!/home |title=Percy Jackson Sea of Monsters - Official Movie Site - View Trailers |publisher=Percyjacksonthemovie.com |date=August 7, 2013 |accessdate=October 30, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Hypable.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.hypable.com/2013/10/09/percy-jackson-sea-of-monsters-dvd-blu-ray-release-date-special-features/ |title='Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters' hits DVD/Blu-ray December 17 |publisher=Hypable.com |date=October 9, 2013 |accessdate=October 30, 2013}}</ref>
==Sequel== On March 25, 2014, Lerman said that a sequel to ''Sea of Monsters'' would not be made.<ref>{{cite news |first=Charles|last=Webb | url = http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1724757/percy-jackson-3-logan-lerman.jhtml | title = Logan Lerman Says 'Percy Jackson 3' Is Officially Dead | publisher = [[MTV News]] | accessdate = March 25, 2014}}</ref> However, six days later the report stated "Logan Lerman has said ''Percy Jackson 3'' could still go ahead" and that the previous report "was taken out of context".<ref>{{cite news |first=Daisy|last=Wyatt |date=March 31, 2014 |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/news/noah-star-logan-lerman-percy-jackson-3-could-still-happen-9226407.html |title=Noah star Logan Lerman: Percy Jackson 3 could still happen |newspaper=The Independent |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref> At the 2015 Santa Barbara International Film Festival, Lerman said that while he finds the ''Percy Jackson'' films fun to make, he has not heard anything about the production of a third film and expressed concern that he and his co-stars were growing too old for their parts.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://dailynexus.com/2015-02-05/a-list-celebrities-flood-to-the-arlington-for-virtuosos-award/|title=A-List Celebrities Flood to the Arlington for Virtuosos Award|newspaper=The Daily Nexus}}</ref>
In December 2017, [[The Walt Disney Company]] agreed to a 52.4-billion-dollar deal to [[Proposed acquisition of 21st Century Fox by Disney| acquire]] [[21st Century Fox]], including the film rights for Percy Jackson.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/business/wp/2017/12/14/disney-buys-much-of-fox-in-mega-merger-that-will-shake-world-of-entertainment-and-media/|title=Disney buys much of Fox in megamerger that will shake world of entertainment and media|first=Steven|last=Zeitchik|date=December 14, 2017|publisher=|access-date=December 29, 2017|via=www.WashingtonPost.com}}</ref>
